Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. Great rooms, friendly staff and one of the best food operations anywhere. I don't mean for this to sound like a commercial but just don't think you can do better for the money. The antique collection alone is enough reason to go there. This Hotel would cost 5 times their rate if it were anywhere else in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buffet & 777 Micro Brewery”
Reviews.Author: candypop75
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights in Vegas April 23-26. I stayed 2 nights at Main Station and it was awesome as always. The staff, food and atmosphere are great! I love there rooms because they are big, clean and so bright. The only downfall was I wanted to use the pool at California Station but it was closed due to a storm coming in. The 777 Micro Brewery has 1/2 price appy's from 3pm-6pm and the beer is the best around. I'm already starting to plan my next vacation in August and hoping to stay at Main Station. I would highly recommended the Main Station!

Reviews.Title: “Best food downtown!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom090
Reviews.Content: The 777 Micro brewery in Main Street Station has some of the best food in Vegas for the cheapest price. There buffet is great, too, but the micro brewery is top notch, with everything from burgers, salads, pizzas, steaks, there is something for everyone at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “More than you would expect”
Reviews.Author: SgtMikes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Las Vegas and stayed at Main Street Station near the Fremont Street experience. We were right in the middle of the action. The folks who work at the Station were outstanding and the accomodations were very good. The price was less than expected and the food at the buffet was great. We highly recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “Main Steet Station Buffet”
Reviews.Author: EmmarB1120
Reviews.Content: The buffet on Saturday night was prime rib but I was engaged eating five different varieties of fish plus mussels and shrimp. There were six different eating area with a great variety of food - enough to fit anyone's tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic Casino”
Reviews.Author: poepoe
Reviews.Content: The old woodworking, stained glass windows and furniture of yesteryear. Newest casino slots and machines. Some of the Old Vegas remains. Good odds on the machines. The Buffet in Main Street Station has a great menu selection also and worthy of trying when downtown.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Nomdegeneric
Reviews.Content: I was rather disappointed by my stay at Main Street Station. I was on the seventh floor, and there was noise from the nearby freeway in the room. (High floors are probably not bad in this regard.) The room was clean but poorly maintained--loose fixtures and a dripping faucet in the tub, a big burn hole on top of the bedspread, the finish worn off the bottom of the bathroom door. I was very disappointed by the buffet at breakfast--no vegetables of any kind, and other than an omelet-making station, everything seemed like it had been standing for a long time. The pluses, other than the price, are that the place is easy to navigate, staff is friendly, they have good beer brewed in-house and it's an easy walk to Fremont Street. Not terrible, but below the standard of other Vegas hotels where I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great, but watch out on the penny Keno...”
Reviews.Author: IdaSlapter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our Anniversary. Pleased with the hotel, food, restaurants, etc...However, just a tip about gaming...They have their penny Keno set up to pay less than at other casinos. We went over to Binion's where the payouts are fair. Always check the pays...make sure you get your just rewards if you win. I hit an 8 out of 8 on penny Keno, and normally (betting 3 cents a card on 20 card) this would be a win of 300 dollars. Here only 150. Sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Eat The Buffet !!”
Reviews.Author: LVGambler
Reviews.Content: My family lives in LV and we do Brunch on Sundays without fail. Im not a huge fan of the Buffet to begin with but OMG!!! To start, we were supposed invited guests, a separate VIP line, which we still stood in line for over 35 mins. with 2 couples ahead of us. Then there were no seating when we paid so we were set aside in a weird area w/ no seating for no joke another 40 mins. before someone came and took us to our table. The joy gets only better. As being shown our table I turned the corner to get the pleasure of seeing a gentleman sneeze openly across a span of at least 4 dishes. Yummy. I stuck with the firewood pizza which was basically cardboard coated with tomato paste and an inexpensive cheese. Please, of you're determined to eat a buffet in Vegas, do yourself a favor and splurge some. You do get what you pay for in this city. In spades. Avoid at all costs. Eat at McDonalds if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Christopher P
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay at Main Street Station. I did not rent a car so I cannot comment on parking, charges, etc for that. I also did not gamble at the casino (although I am a craps enthusiast, and with 20x odds it took quite some self-discipline to stay away from the tables). The buffet is excellent!! I only went to the breakfast buffet, which at the time of this writing is $7 per person and has all the variety that you would expect from a Vegas casino. Weekend mornings are a little more, $11 or $12 each with all you can drink champagne. Casino seemed a little less smoky than the golden nugget, four queens or binions. The craps tables still had positions open evening during weekend evening peak hours, though this could have simply been the result of the table going cold. The room is pretty good. I didn't spend that much time in the room. I got a room on the 11th floor on the freeway side so I got some freeway noise while trying to sleep, but this was nothing compared to the other type of noise while staying at the Flamingo a few days after I checked out here. I wanted to use the shuttle service offered, but I didn't know where Sam's town is and did not want to wait forever to get to the strip. I elected to buy a 24hr bus pass instead for $7. Elevator service is snap-quick. A relief if you've ever stayed at places like Bally's or Luxor or especially Imperial Palace (ugh).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Casino, location is off downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: Great place to visit with nice people. Still carries Old Las Vegas charm though. If you are a video poker player, and you get a four of a kind, press your change light and a change person brings you a scratch card that is worth anything from $1 - $5000. That's REALLY nice. If you are downtown, this is just an extra 5 minute walk. The buffet smells yummy too. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, very good value food, good base”
Reviews.Author: ITTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Main Street Station Hotel as part of a group trip for a week in Las Vegas centred on the Rugby Sevens tournament. The hotel is in Downtown (think classic Las Vegas) rather than the 'Strip' where many of the modern hotel/casinos and their shows are. You can get to the Strip by bus or taxi in less than half an hour. The hotel rooms are a little old in decor (so no flat screen TV, Internet, bit short on mains sockets) but were clean and well maintained. The bed was comfortable (I prefer a firmer bed rather than a marshmallow) and despite some traffic noise I slept well. Hotel has a really good buffet restaurant with a range of international food that was rally good value.It also has a 'Brew Pub' or microbrewery with some good, award winning beers although these were a little rich for my taste. Buffet and Pub can be busy at peak times and you may need to queue. You can expect to pay a lot less here for good food and drink than hotels on the Strip. It proved to be a good base for visits to the Strip, the Rugby Sevens (staff helpful in booking group transport) and out to locations such as the Grand Canyon. Not really a gambler, so can't comment on the Casino aspect - but get the free 'Connect' card from the Casino that gives you a small discount at the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - great property - great value - good rooms”
Reviews.Author: cosmoaction
Reviews.Content: Main Street Station is our favorite hotel in town. Rates are very reasonable, and there is ample free parking in their ramp right outside the North Entrance. The casino has good machines and decent table games. The triple 7 brewpub has the best beer in all LV, and the garlic fries and chicken wing appetizers are must tries as well. It is a 1 1/2 block walk to Fremont street (all indoors except crossing one street). The rooms are actually the weakest part of the whole property, and they aren't bad. They are attractive and furniture is nice. The TV's are old and channel selection is not great. Louvered blinds with no curtains are fine with me but do let some light in. Traffic noise from the freeway is pronounced in rooms on the North side of the building (even # rooms). There is railroad noise on the south side, but not nearly as bad as the traffic noise. The view to the south from the higher floors is very nice. (Try going out on the outside stairwell at night for the best view.) The hotel is close to the new performing arts center and a premium outlet mall.) It's also only two blocks from the IRS building!! There is no fitness center or pool. (can use the Cal's pool)

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: FrankG1955
Reviews.Content: Only criticisms were no coffee making machine in the room and totally naff choice of tv stations and the noise from the railway. Very good beer at great prices too. Very good buffet and meals in the Brewery restaurant - great value- saved a fortune on Strip prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Casino”
Reviews.Author: Palamides
Reviews.Content: My friend and I made our way down the strip via the deus bus Sunday afternoon March 18, 2012. We exited off Freemont street and walked freemont to Fitzgeralds and turned left. It was a short walk to main street station. We walked in and were impressed by the detial work on the cieling, the mix of old and new slots and nicely laid out casino floor. Made our way to Triple 7 brewery and had an amazing meal and beers for very cheap. Belive me cheaper than El Paso, TX is cheap. After getting soaked up on the other end of the strip it was nice to feel like you were getting something for your money (with a nod to the great margarita they made me at 4 Queens). I had a prime rib dinner, and three finely crafted pints of beer for $20 bucks. I noticed the prices for the buffett which is apparently one of the highest rated in Vegas was around $7-8 for breakfast lunch and $10.99 for dinner. We proceeded to the roulette table and played several hours enjoying our luck and the friendly staff. Five dollar minimum bet limit was nice. We asked to see a room and were immediately given a key. The rooms liked just fine for the $31/night rate i saw on the internet yesterday. A great find and will definitely return. If you like brewery beer you should check out this place.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience”
Reviews.Author: OLDBRITDoncaster
Reviews.Content: We are big fans of downtown and try to stay at one hotel on or near Fremont St every trip. Having been impressed with the look of Main St, on our last brief visit to the casino floor, this time we stayed for three nights. We loved the interiors and the room we had was not only excellent value, it was also in keeping with the Victorian theme of dark wood and ageing opulence. The room we had was on the third floor overlooking the roof area so the view was nothing special, but then who goes to Vegas to stare out of their bedroom window? Pretty good buffet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: lovemesumvegas
Reviews.Content: Wow- what a great place to stay downtown. For the price ($29 per night spring special S-Th), you really can't get a nicer room with good, friendly staff. My buddy and I had a room on the 16th floor- we requested a high floor, odd number room near the elevators and our request was granted instantly with a smile. The odd number room gave us a room facing the FSE and the strip, which made for a great view. The high number floor gave us a mini fridge in the room on a non-smoking floor. Didn't even have a hint of smoke smell in the room or floor. The beds were comfortable and the decor bright and updated. The only (small) complaints I have are the small, old tv and the low shower heads. Loved the breakfast buffet with Manny slinging the omelets and banter at the omelet station. Loved the Berlin Wall. Loved the location near FSE and other properties. Would stay again in a minute. Not ideal if you are looking for a "resort", but for a nice, smaller, personable experience of downtown, this a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “All-Around Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gotarheels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at MSS for the second time in January 2012. There is really no bad thing to say about this place, other than (in summer months) the lack of a decent pool. FYI...you can use the pool at the 'Cal but it's rather poor by Vegas standards. Rooms are spacious, clean, and well-appointed, especially considering the price. I found the service in the entire property to be outstanding. Check-In was freindly, drink service is quick (super-quick if you tip well). On my last night, I met with the on-duty casino host for about three minutes. She comped my room with no problem...a process that would have been much more time-consuming in a Strip property. The 777 Brew Pub serves delicious food almost 24/7 (they close for a few hours in the morning); the buffet is one of the best in town and is in a beautiful room; the casino bar serves stiff cheap drinks ($3 highballs) around the clock. Add to all of the above: An interesting environment for anyone who loves history. The main lobby is full of antique slot machines and railroad memorabilia. The main casino floor has a beautiful stained glass ceiling complete with chandeliers. I haven't actually seen it, but I hear you can urinate in front of the Berlin Wall in one of the men's rooms. What's not to Love?

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: mlr8105
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in 8 months at the MMS and again, I was satisfied. The room was clean, the beds slept well and was quite even though my 9th floor room faced the Interstate. The Buffet and Triple 7 restaurant were again good and affordable. I would like to thank Rita (front desk) and John ( Bellman) for their fast and friendly service. I was in town for the Nascar race and even though the hotel was sold out, the customer service was not slowed. Keep up the good work MMS!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, so-so room”
Reviews.Author: Marci H
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a plain Jane, no frills place. There were not a whole lot of amenities, but we enjoyed it nonetheless. We checked in Wednesday afternoon and the desk staff could not be nicer. We had room 401 on the fourth floor at the end of the hall by the stairwell. The good: the room was clean. Our bed was VERY comfortable. We did not hear any noise from the hallway or other rooms. The walk from the elevator to the room was short. We never had to wait for an elevator like at some of the larger hotels. The bad: the outside noise from the roof fans/air conditioning was awful when they fired up! The weatherstripping around one of the windows was missing and the wind whistled in like crazy. The view was of the lower roof and the railroad tracks. We ate at the Triple 7 a few times. The quesadilla appetizer was the best one we tried. The burgers were good, the steak, not so much. Loved the beers. Linda, the bartender was awesome and helpful! The Garden Court Buffet breakfast was pretty good. The seafood buffet was also good. The servers were super prompt taking care of us. The only cranky employee we ever encountered was when we asked to be seated at a different table at the buffet and the hostess gave us attitude. But we just let it roll off us. Hot tip: If you have no coffemaker in your room, just call the front desk. They delivered coffee maker and supplies quickly and did not charge extra (unlike some larger downtown hotels.) We loved the decor and all the woodwork. My husband is a carpenter and he was opening doors and drawers and loving the craftsmanship. It was almost embarrasing when he stroked the wood (heehee.) Much better than some tacky places in the area. We got a private tour of the pullman by asking and we also took the small lift upstairs to the billiard area. WOW! I would recommend this for a couples trip or a trip with friends, providing you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Better gaming area that neighboring California”
Reviews.Author: culaxman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the California, not Main Street, so comments are limited to the gaming area (better than the California), the bar (also better than the Cal's bar and serves decent microbrews) as well as the Garden Court Buffet. The Garden Court Buffet is listed as one of Las Vegas' top buffets and it did not dissapoint. Admittedly this is not in the same league as the Wicked Spoon (at the Cosmopolitan), but this is half the price. The buffet had excellent variety ranging from generous salad and fruit offerings to moist carved turkey and everything in between. For breakfast good eggs, range of breakfast meat, with "Portuguese" sausage being my favorite. Tried this for lunch also once and the quality and variety did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “stay, eat, play all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: alimae2012
Reviews.Content: Main Street Station is my favorite in Vegas to stay and play. Rooms are nothing special but comfortable and clean, safe to go to your room alone without worry. Tripple 777 micro brew resturant never dissapoints. Mon. to Fri. happy hour specials are terrific. The buffet is very good also have specials everyday. Great poker machines and table games, only place I go that you see winners all the time! I stay here every year with 10 women, we love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Downtown”
Reviews.Author: tomkc1
Reviews.Content: Downtown Las Vegas is our favoirte area to stay in. Main Street Station is our favorite hotel. We've stayed at many hotels downtown but always go back to Main Street. The rooms are large, clean and bright. Also, the rates are always reasonable. This property has everything anyone needs from the nice rooms I mentioned plus a number of selections for good food at reasonable prices. I think the casino is one of the best. If you get the coupon sheet from Fremont St Experience the is a 2 for 1 to the Main Street buffet. Its a good one. The only negative in my opinion is the TV selection. I'm sure thats by design. The owners don't want you staying in the rooms. They want you spending your money. Some might say that the train tracks are a negative but they don't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, better than the last.”
Reviews.Author: ernestoc33
Reviews.Content: As always the food and stay was phenomenal. The 777 restaurant has great micro-brew on tap at a low price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Caesars in vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: we stopped into this casino to hit the main street buffet. it was fantastic great selection and good price (approx $13 per person) the hidden gem was while waiting for the buffet to open, we sat at the bar just outside of the buffet entrance and ordered a round of caesars. they were the best Caesars we've ever had! we had about 3 rounds of them and started a 4th before going to eat! worth trying!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE WORTH THE BLOCK WALK”
Reviews.Author: hooglesnorpus
Reviews.Content: Try taking the 1 block walk to this place next time your in downtown Vegas. It is colorful and clean. Buffet was very good, Tues nite was t-bone steak nite there. Delcious. Good size place too, not a tiny joint.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, old school lodging.”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I have stayed at Main Street Station 3 or 4 times in the past 8 years, finding it a reliable, inexpensive alternate to the glitz and high prices on the Strip.This is especially true during the CES convention week, the second week of January. Our room averaged $60 a night...a price that can't be beat during this 'expensive ' convention week where hotels routinely double their nightly rate for conventioneers. What you get is a no frills room complete with a tube TV with about 12 viewable channels, no in-room wireless internet but a comfortable bed with a passable bathroom. Speaking of the bathroom, the showerhead came to about my neck in height (I am 6') which is a joke. The shower squuked out a thin mist probably saving the hotel larger water bills. Rooms were quiet, the hallway was quiet and the elevators always were there when you wanted them and without crowds. The hotel seems to cater to Hawaiian travel groups, oddly enough. We liked the brewpub and buffet were very good in terms of both price and food quality.I would say that the hotel lacks a simple coffee and roll kiosk like a Starbucks or Caribou. With the low room price you get no frills such as room service, internet , flat screen TV,etc but the value you receive with the low room price justifies the lack of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Greta Value”
Reviews.Author: babs53
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas,January 16th. A friend and I spent four nights there. Our room faced the freeway, and there was some noise from the freeway and, and occasional train. I didn't come to Vegas to sleep so they weren't a bother but you need to be aware in case your a light sleeper. The rooms were very clean and the hotel in general was very well maintained.I have eaten numerous times at the buffet and it is always very good. A good value and even better if you have a player's card. I would come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Third time's a charm”
Reviews.Author: s_ingsK1Y
Reviews.Content: There's a reason I keep coming back to this hotel - the service is impeccable. From the cocktail servers to the front desk staff, they always seem genuinely pleased to be doing what they do. For a low roller like me, it's a pleasant surprise for a CW to remember us a year later. Not only that, but remember what we drink! The rooms are pretty standard, I stayed in king room this trip as I was flying solo for a change. Nothing to complain about, not even the freeway noise that seems to bother some people. I never hear it. The rooms are large by most downtown standards, the beds are comfortable. The shower takes a minute of work to get the water to the right temperature. Food options are the buffet or Triple 7 Brewpub. I've had good meals at both.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in vegas”
Reviews.Author: michaelcrossan
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 12 days in vegas last november and dined in several buffets in downtown and strip.Without any shadow of doubt the Main street station buffet is not only the best value in vegas the quality of food is second to none.The selection of deserts is out of this world such a varity to choose from.One can eat here for very little for such good food.Its a pity there were not more like it,well done MSS.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Lodging in Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AONE5
Reviews.Content: Visited Las Vegas as part of a larger trip around the USA to catch up with friends. I like downtown and have previously stayed in the Golden Nugget, but fancied a change. I've visited the MSS before as the Brewpub and Buffet are excellent - and they still are. Hotel wise - the rooms are nothing special, but the rates are good and have all the usual facilities. There seem to be a number of tour groups, but there was never a queue at reception when I needed service. Let's be clear - this isn't the Bellagio, but it is a reasonable place to stay downtown with a good places to eat and drink in the building. It's a short, safe, walk to Freemont Street - you can do most of it in casinos with one road to cross. If you are a light sleeper, beware as the hotel does back on to the Railroad and the nearby freeway can be heard in some rooms. NB - there is no pool.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for/ no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: nowheretgo
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on this hotel from a travel site. Glad I did not pay too much. The hotel is down town, a few blocks from experience, but seems like a long walk when your feet hurt from walking strip and when it's cold. There are low cost hotels closer and from what I was heard better. The room was clean and run down. There was something wrong with the bathtub and they just glued a sheet of plastic? to the bottom. This had a rather strange look and feel. makes you wonder what is under the plastic and if it was comming out from under the plastic in the water as you were showering. Glad I do not take a baths so it only got my feet. The shower itself was very difficult to regulate the temp. Sometimes this was worse than others. You'd have it nice then go hot or cold. I had to plan extra time for showers, almost impossible to regulate temp at certain times. The hotel is a no frills type that wants you think it is high class, it is not. The worst part is the lack of knowledge of the staff. I asked several questions about the area to staff. No one knows anything. I had to call other hotels for info. that Main Street staff should have been able to provide easily. The other hotels could answer my questions without hesitation. At one point I was looking for a service most hotels offer free for their guests everyone surprised not offered at Main street. I could not access the service from other hotels not being a guest. I was very lucky that the Golden Nugget( who provides the service free for their guests) was also able to direct me to where I could get it in the community. Thank you Golden Nugget staff!! Main street did not offer the service and could not even direct me to where to find it. There seems to be no services offered at Main Street. My cell phone died while I was there and had to make an important call. They charge for phone calls from your room, they will not let you use a phone at the desk or in the lobby (a one minute phone call). They do have free parking? I had to call 3 times to find out where it was and was given wrong directions. This is seems very typical for them. I still don't know were the free parking is. I gave up ended up using valet (of course). There is no WIFI in rooms. There is suppose to be Wifi some somewhere in lobby (a small part of lobby across from desk). I did not look. I wanted to download movie to watch on flight while packing and was not able to without taking additional time and dressing and sitting down stairs for down load. Needless to say I did not watch movie on return flight. They offer no room service. I wanted to place an order for food to go. This can not be called in, the resturant will not take calls and doesn't seem to like to making things to go. I ended up buying food from elsewhere when I felt like eatting in not to hassel with them. If you are taking any early tours the Main Street resturant is not open until late and you cannot even get a cup of coffee in the morning before you leave. A bottle of water is $2 in their machine which is all you can get. They do NOT have coffee pots or refridge in rooms. I asked for a refridge in my room for my medication and this was not working right either, hot or frozen like a brick. I asked the cleaning person for an extra shampoo, lets just say not joyfully given. They have no concierge their bell man acts as concierge, useless but will want tip. I found out the day I left that a female can ask the attendant to get the men out of the bathroom so you can see the Berlin wall. They are suppose to have a piece there used as a urinal in the men's bathroom. I thought being a female I was just SOL to see it. Did not get to see because found out leaving Vegas I how to go about it. I'm sure there would be a hassel doing this that they will expect a large tip for this as always in Main Street Station (I am a big tipper anyway, but I hate to be pushed for it). I think I will try elsewhere even if it cost a little more, possibly the Nugget. Looking for the bright side all I can say is hotel room seemed clean, the food was o-kay ( not great) at 777 -Main Street Station Resturant and the price for the motel room.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the very first time Tripadvisor has steered me wrong.”
Reviews.Author: HeyNow-Hank
Reviews.Content: I don't know why reviewers have been so kind to this hotel's ROOMS. Everything else about the property was great (and accurate). The rooms (two of them), however, were a different story. I checked in very early, and I was happy that a room was available. It was a handicapped room. However, I've stayed in them in other hotels before and never had a problem. I should have clued in when the desk clerk mentioned, "See how you like it. If you don't, come down and let me know. When I got into the room, it was just slightly above "flop-house" quality. One of the pillowcases was obviously dirty, as were some of the tabletops. Almost all the furniture was chipped, the TV was an old-fashioned CRT, and the walls looked like they hadn't been refinished in 40 years. The bathroom, however, was clean, and the room had a refrigerator. I wanted to sleep for a few hours, so I was satisfied that I would be allowed to change rooms the next day. The next day, I moved into a regular room on a different floor. Once again, lots of dirty tabletops and chipped furniture. The new room had the same type of old-fashioned TV, and the phone was filthy. The pillowcases, however, were all clean, the walls were better, the bathroom was very clean, and the room still had a (free) refrigerator. The casino is very laid back, as about 80% of the clientele are retired Hawaiians. The best thing about the casino is the full-pay 25 cent 10/7 video poker. It's actually better than 100.17%, as all 4-of-a-kinds get a scratch card for more winnings (as long as you have your B Connected Card in the machine and you wait for the slot attendant before playing another hand. Buffet is excellent and well priced. Also, a very cool coffee shop (Market Street Cafe) is right across the indoor walkway at their sister property, the California. Bottom line, next time I'll stay back at Four Queens (the second best rooms downtown, after Golden Nugget). However, I will come back for the full pay video poker.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bsparks
Reviews.Content: Excellent food at the buffet of the mini-brewery. The rooms and service are top notch. The best bang for your buck in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden value”
Reviews.Author: travelingsteveo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in august . The room is very basic but clean and nice. Buffet is awesome only about 8 dollars and it is set back a little bit of off fremont st which i liked. Everyone here was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: kabbagehead
Reviews.Content: I would compare Main Street Station to a movie you hear hyped up and talked about as something really great, but when you see it, it’s good, but doesn’t live up to expectations (many of which were formed reading reviews on this website.) Frommer's guidebook lists it as one of the best places to stay in the Fremont Street area. There is a lot to like about Main Street Station. First, the casino and check-in area are really cool: bright and clean, and decorated with a 1900s San Francisco vibe. There is lots of brass and wood; just very nicely executed. This casino caters primarily to people from Hawaii, and you are going to see many, many older, retired Hawaiians milling around. Maybe it's the whole Aloha mentality, but these people are really friendly, but this is about as far from hip and happening Vegas as you can get. Many of the people who work there also seem to have come from Hawaii as well. In addition, the buffet is a very good deal, but not quite as good as it has been in the past: WHAT is the DEAL with casinos no longer serving real cream with coffee? The microbrewery dishes out good pub grub, good beer, and also has a sushi bar just, you know, because. So why only three stars? Well, because of the rooms - and more specifically - the shower. The television was a big 'ol Zenith, probably circa 1995. You can count on about 15 channels, but hey, I didn't come to Vegas to watch TV. The bed and bedding were definitely on the economy side, though it was reasonably comfortable. There is a very small lock box to stash your loot. It was clean and well-kept. This is one of those old-school hotels where there are doors that connect rooms. The heating and A/C are operated by knobs on the unit, not a thermostat on the wall. Again though, it worked. But not the shower. Now, I will say that when you do turn on the water, water comes out the shower, and you get clean. But this is a very, very moody shower, whose water temperature seems dictated by how people are using water in other rooms. You know: it's the old joke of flushing the toilet while someone is taking a shower to hear them shout in disgust. So, often times I would have the shower going at a good temp, only to be blasted by either scalding or icy water. It got to be where I had to ready to jump at any given time in order to avoid this. Taking a shower in my own hotel room made me paranoid about the water that was about to hit me! Ugh. To make things even more bizarre, you turn the water on going "righty-tighty," not "lefty-loosey," so it's backwards. In addition, shower overall was pretty rundown. This really is not acceptable for any hotel. Is Main Street Station a good deal? Probably. But many of the user reviews I see on this website and others rank it between 4 and 4.5 stars. Huh? Maybe they had a working shower or had just hit the jackpot before they wrote their review. (Brief side note: MSS, The California, and The Fremont are all next to each other and all are owned by Boyd Gaming. For Blackjack players such as myself, they offer some of the stingiest rules; you might wish to play elsewhere: for the best rules, walk to El Cortez; conversely, they have great rules on Craps.) If you get a really good deal, you probably won't be disappointed. But Beware of The Shower! (Enter scary music...)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, love the decor, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: mythrenegade
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent getaway to vegas. This is not a high end casino, but it is a nice place to stay at very reasonable rates. The lobby and overall decor of this place is gorgeous. Lots of woods, brass, metal etc. It feels like an early 20th century train station. The rooms themselves are just average. They were clean and comfortable, but nothing terribly special. On the other hand, for the price, they were a cut above everything else you would find. The 777 brewpub has a nice selection of beers that they brew themselves, and they are very good. Good beer is hard to find in Vegas, so this is a big plus. Happy hour is not only cheap, but they have buckets of shrimp for only $5 each that are very tasty. The buffet was cheap and the food provided was very tasty. I am not a big buffet fan, but I would do breakfast there again. The location is good, about a two block walk from the Plaza Hotel and the start of the Fremont Street Experience. For its location, its good restaurants, wonderful decor and clean rooms, I really like this hotel. Joel Joel

Reviews.Title: “friendly but tired”
Reviews.Author: SWDCtraveler
Reviews.Content: I really like the public areas of Main St Station - the vintage look to the casino, the pub and its solid microbrews (also available from the cocktail waitresses), and the Hawaiian vibe (given the longstanding tour packages). I usually end up here during a visit to town. I don't normally stay here, but did one night on a recent (quiet) Friday. The room was looking pretty tired - a little musty, tub didn't drain well, some water damage on the ceiling, the curved shower bar was drooping down, etc. Also, Owner Boyd is using cheap made in China toiletries, which are of noticeably mediocre quality. That said, it was adequate for my needs, with friendly faces, quick checkin/checkout, and a bed I was able to sleep well in. For one night at $50, it was great. Not sure if I could do a weeklong dream Vegas vacation there, though. For food, the hotel is great, but be sure to take the skybridge to the Cal for fantastic ice cream and authentic Hawaiian plate lunch specialties. Also, a Hash House a Go Go just opened down the street in the Plaza - a great up and coming mini chain that's been featured on Man vs Food.

Reviews.Title: “Book directly and enjoy the great woodwork!”
Reviews.Author: MinnTex
Reviews.Content: The lobby and casino areas were a throw-back to a time of craftsmanship--lots of carved wood, old chandeliers, vintage mirrors. A nice change from the new mega-resorts in Vegas! My room was on the 9th floor, recently refurbished, clean, comfortable, and well-appointed (except for the SD TV with not many channels, but who watches TV in Vegas?). It was away from the elevators and the trains and freeway, so was quiet. I booked directly with the hotel, which was significantly less expensive than the other hotel search sites. Checking in and out were a breeze, and getting from the car to the room took only a few minutes--again a nice change from the newer and glitzier mega-hotels in Vegas. Dinner in the brewpub was good and some of the beers were really tasty (I had the beer sampler and liked 4 of 5). It is convenient to the Fremont Street Experience, which is a fun place to go for adults. The only downside is that It's a bit of a drive from the airport, but not that far. I liked it and could easily see returning!

Reviews.Title: “Solid down town hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tommy72A
Reviews.Content: Stayed couple of nights on comp but I would consider this hotel with or without the comps. Brew pub is an excellent place to hang and watch the game and one of the better blackjack rules in d/t. Place is clean and safe. Lots of visitors from Hawaii and many of them are repeat customers. I'm talking repeat 10-15-20 years. If downtown is on your agenda, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Main Street Station Casino & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmarB1120
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the hotel but the casino and property was a romantic trip into the past. The self-guided tour was very easy and informative. (Pick up the printed route at the front desk) I was duly impressed with the rail cars adjacent to the hotel and the history of their use. By the way, the brewery is second to none. I've never had a better IPA. The food there is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravelSouth
Reviews.Content: We were comped 3 nights at this hotel. It is updated and clean, has a great buffet. We are really into using So we went back down to the Cal front desk (they share the pool with the CAl) and were told it was open. Got a key and went up again only to find from 1 - 3 the sun is behind Las Vegas Club. We used it one day and it was dirty. Canceled last night at Main Street and Went back to Fitzgeralds. The casino is fine and the hotel is clean but we are all about the pool.

Reviews.Title: “The Main Place is Main Sreet Station”
Reviews.Author: dirt farmer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here numerous times but never on the 17th floor. Very nice view of the Plaza and the train tracks. The buffet is one of the best in Las Vegas. The staff is nice and seem to remember me each trip. I'm a video poker player and this casino has some of the best pay tables in town. Over all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Very nice place just off Fremont street”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: A B-Connected - Boyd property so decent standards. Nice rooms with quality furnishings. Located a block off Fremont street ( so essentially quieter at night ...no Fremont Street Experience noise, BUT a train passes by around 5 am, so request a room away from tracks) Im not a buffet type person but this was actually quite decent. Went on steak and shrimp scampi night. wide selection of items and well presented. property is connected by walkway to the California Club. Casino has assorted table and slot machine. Some full pay poker machines and craps odds at 20x so best place in vegas for that. Newest machines co exist with the standards * TiP * Sign up online for BConnected Players card online before making a reservation and get the B Connected discount rate, and if you play, as your players card level increases so does your discount I look forward to experiencing this property again

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, and clean.”
Reviews.Author: 1998rc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and really enjoyed it. The price is right, the facilities were updated. Though the building is old, the new remodel has made it very nice, I would say maybe one of the nicest in downtown. Yes just so you know it does smell in the casino area a little of smoke, but I have been to worse. We enjoyed a beer in their brewery restaurant and it was great. We also went for a late meal at 3:30AM to the same restaurant and enjoyed their steak and eggs and french toast for a total of $13. The waitress was great even though it was the middle of the night. By the way if you want this deal its only between 2:00 AM and 7:00 AM. So go after you party. Cant tell you much about the rooms, because we stayed in their RV park and it was very nice, secure, and clean. We are already making reservations for December. This hotel is not on freemont street, however it is connected by enclosed walkways through the California hotel over to Freemont street if your not wanting to go outside. The best part is the atmospher, people were friendly, and all kinds were there, classy dressed up, and casuall tourist clothing, it didnt matter, it was fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to play craps in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kcchin
Reviews.Content: For all you serious craps players out there, you all know the importance of the 'odds' bet or 'behind the line'. The table limits here at Main Street are usually $5-$1000 with 20x odds. It would be hard to find a bettter game of craps than offered here at Main Street. It is a Boyd's Corporation company and all Boyd's properties make an Extra effort into taking care of their guests especially when getting their money's worth either in their room rates or the food offered at their various locations (California Hotel for their Prime Rib special during evenings or their Main Street buffet...both excellent value and quality for the price. The only down side is that even on a non-smoking floor, smoke is still a factor from either the age of the casino or the poor ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Bubba
Reviews.Content: This was the third stay for my wife and I at MSS. Once again, check in took less than 5 minutes with a courteous desk clerk. Got room at end of hall on 5th floor. Over the three days we were there, we never heard a peep out of another guest, either through the walls or the hallways. Did hear train one morning but it was nothing to worry about. Elevators were quick and housecleaning did an excellent job. Parking in the garage was easy and check out was very quick. Overall, a great stay and would highly recommend to anyone who wants a clean, quiet place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: ghoff
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The only complaint- the drains in the bathroom are slooow. . If you play in the casino get the players card. Boyd Gaming is pretty generous with free nights on a second visit. The staff in consistantly pleasant and eager to help and please. The pale ale at the brewpub is great.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: Ibbocek
Reviews.Content: Once again, the Main Street Station continues to beat the strip hotels. This is our second time staying here and will never stay on the strip. From the easy check in and check out (minutes) to the friendly atmosphere, we will not stay anywhere else when we are in Vegas. Everything met our needs and the 777 restaurant is beautifully decorated as is the buffet. The Strip has all the glitz but Fremont street has all the fun!

Reviews.Title: “A classic downtown stay.”
Reviews.Author: slotblog
Reviews.Content: Always loved to come and hang here and play at the Boar bar. Never too crowded, plenty of seats and good paying video poker and comp drinks. They have their own micro brwery and food there was well worth it. The hotel has a good amount of history, friendly staff and does not attract any downtown sleaze. The rooms are basic, clean but adequate. easy to get comps on not much play.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 808SHERYL
Reviews.Content: We usually stay on the strip but when meeting up with friends from Hawaii the Main Street is the place. The room and meals were comped so you can't beat that. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was small compared to other hotels but good enough. Our shower drain was really slow but after removing some clogged hair it went down a lot better. That kind of grossed me out but I think having dirty water cover your feet while you shower is just as bad. Thank goodness I packed gloves with my disinfecting wipes. We ate at the buffet and at Triple 7 and enjoyed it very much as usual. Unfortunately we can't get a comped room during a specific week in November so will stay on the strip but we will be back someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EveTurner
Reviews.Content: Caters to Asian/Hawaiians, but good place to sleep. Beds & pillows very comfortable. Rooms spacious. Walking distance to Freeman Street Experience & downtown LV. No fast food or coffee. Must walk over to Californian. Don't play slots here or anywhere in Las Vegas for that matter. Slots are tight, tight, tight. All over LV, at ALL Casinos. Won't return. Hotel ok, but LV for slots, no.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: geoa5
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night in early August. The room was number 1530, so higher floor, facing the highway. The noise wasn't too bad from highway, didn't interrupt sleep. The room, while small was very adequette. The room was renovated recently, as is evident in furnishings, paint, carpet, etc. The bathroom is pretty small, but clean. The in room safe actually had a key, and if you lost it there was a penalty of some sort, I never used the safe. The buffet here is very good and also very cheap, would definitely come back for the buffet. I am not a fan of the downtown area, but wanted to try this hotel because of the good reviews, so when I found out i can get the room comped I took it. If you like downtown, then I would recommend you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: candypop75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at MSS twice and love this place. The room is so clean, big and very bright. The air conditioning works so well that I had to turn it off at night because it was way too cold. We booked a really cheap, good deal on expedia.com. The seafood buffet is so yummy and well worth the price. I am looking to go back to MSS in November because they treated us so well with comps.

Reviews.Title: “Boat load of GOOD food at the buffet”
Reviews.Author: rekabs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget but the 2 block walk to Main Street's buffet was well worth it. Had breakfast once , lunch once and b runch once during my family reunion stay. Price wise-taste wise-service wise 100 percent better than Golden Nugget's buffet which I had twice during my stay, once for lunch and once for the seafood buffet -which should be renamed, 'See no seafood' buffet. Service was so great at the Main Street buffet that the waitress remembered my coffee order from the previous day. decaf vs non-decaf. Even heard another customer complement one of the cooks-telling him their trout is always cooked perfectly no matter what time of the year he comes. The winding mile long buffet was awesome at all three visits. The food was hot, appealling to the eye,easy on the wallet and sensational to the tongue ! Hats off to the entire staff....Loved every bite of it.!!!.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Tennessee
Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Away From The Crowd!”
Reviews.Author: joaks
Reviews.Content: We got there at around 6 pm on a Friday Evening. Check-in was brisk with very little line. The room was pretty basic by Vegas standards, but it was clean and comfortable. We got 2 queens because my wife's friend stayed with us and it didn't feel too crowded. The beds were nice and the AC worked fine. The decorations of the hotel make you feel very old Vegas like with all the hardwood, Train Station type settings, and signage. All in all, this was a good choice for our first two nights in Vegas. We always wanted to stay downtown and I love the fact that this hotel along with the California are a block back away from the crowds of Fremont. The walk to Fremont is a short one anyway, as you use a covered, Air Conditioned Skybridge to get to the California, and then a short walk through the Plaza. We ate at the Triple 777 Brewery, Pasta Pirate, and the Garden Buffet. All were Excellent except for the buffet. I wont eat at Main Street's buffet again, but I rarely ever pick a hotel based on it's restaurants anyway, since there are so many places within walking distance in Vegas. This may not be on the same level as the Golden Nugget or City Center, but it is a fine place to stay, especially if you don't want the crowds. The value is extraordinary. I don't rate every hotel by comparing it to the Bellagio or the Vdara, I base it more on my expectations. This wouldn't be a 5 star compared to them, but it exceeded my expectations based on price and value. Don't expect room service and spas here, but for your dollar, expect a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpolito2004
Reviews.Content: Love the western theme, you will not be disappointed, short walk to Fremont St where there is alot of entertainment, the hotel rooms were very nice and clean,, the food in the hotel worth every penny, parking very good, custermer service very good, I would go back again,

Reviews.Title: “great we will be back”
Reviews.Author: chaim01
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent. Clean and spacious. Also when we requested a coffee maker they cheerfully sent one up right away.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay if you want to be close to fremont street”
Reviews.Author: donandpenny
Reviews.Content: it was great except the pool was across the street at the california hotel, there was no frig, microwave or coffe pot and no continental breakfast,otherwise the room was clean and the maid service was great.

Reviews.Title: “We hated it and we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: knitter72
Reviews.Content: The room was dingy and dirty. The carpet was so greasy and dirty that we wouldn't step barefoot onto it. There were two upholstered chairs, so dirty and stained, that we would not sit on them without putting a towel down between us in our underwear and clothes only. Naked was not an option, even on a towel.. The phone was dirty, the room stunk, literally. After complaining, one of the upholstered chairs was replaced with one not quite as dirty, but not clean. The bed, however, on careful inspection was clean except for the blanket. We kept sheets carefully between us and the blanket , The bedspread was so filthy we didn't put our suitcase down on it. The pillows were worn out and skinny.

Reviews.Title: “It was still good a year later.”
Reviews.Author: retired053
Reviews.Content: We went back to the Main Street Station a year after our first visit. This time, our room was comped, as we gambled in their casino. Regardless, we once again enjoyed our stay. Our room was clean, quiet, spacious and cool. Staff was available for whatever you needed. We do not spend much time in the room, so was not concerned with a view. Will again go back.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, glad we came back”
Reviews.Author: s_ingsK1Y
Reviews.Content: I this is going to become our home base if we end up making more trips to Las Vegas. The rooms are large, with comfortable beds. While the bathrooms may be a bit on the small side, that's not a concern. Our room was up on the 12th floor and we experienced none of the freeway noise that some others have noticed. The a/c unit was more than efficient, we often turned it down before falling asleep. We were lucky enough to have a mini-fridge in the room, great for the leftovers and the bottle of champagne from the limo ride. I think it's the staff, though, that keeps us coming back here. I mentioned this to the front desk and she said they have a pretty low staff turnover there, some of the staff have worked there for 10-15 years. Not only does the staff stay, but they do their jobs well. A case in point would be the servers in the casino. It'd been a year since our last visit but one of the cocktail waitresses not only remembered my daughter ( to her amazement) but also remembered her drink of choice. We just your average low rollers, so nothing notable about us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: mlr8105
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MSS by myself for 3 nights. The check in was quick and courteous. I was given a room on the 14th floor with 2 queen beds. The room was clean and had plenty of room and also had a refrigerator. The only negative I found was the shower had a low shower head and there was an occasional train passing in the night - (Hence, Main Street Statioin), but still sleepable. The casino is bright and clean with good customer service. The Garden Court Buffet was really good as well as the Triple 7 Restaurant and was reasonably priced. They have a parking deck (free) that is a quick walk to the Hotel entrance and the Hotel is also a very short walk to Fremont Street ( 5 min). Personally, I loved it and will definately stay again. I have stayed at 4 downtown hotels and the MSS is the best by far.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: rigaux
Reviews.Content: The only important thing to say is that one of the hotel's wing is in front of interstate 15. awfully noisy, all the night long. Really the first important thing to check if you ever go there. The rest is not that

Reviews.Title: “We always stay at the Main Street!”
Reviews.Author: erickjen2011
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is off Fremont Street by a block, it is always our first choice of where to stay. The staff are great and we love the buffet and brewery. I recommend the breakfast buffet and the spicy tuna rolls from the brewery. The rooms are extremely quiet, clean and the bed is comfortable. We've stayed in this hotel 4-5 times and enjoy every visit.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresofScorch
Reviews.Content: The good points, clean reasonable sized functional room, 2 queens, TV, aircon, free wifi in most public areas, free parking on site. Minor niggles, no fridge in room, noisy aircon unit (but it was 110 F outside!), no wifi in room, no tea coffee making facilities in the room but these are very minor niggles bearing in mind the deal I got on hotels.com. I actually booked this hotel expecting the worse and prepared to stay elsewhere and parking the car here, my theory being 3 nights here included free parking and was cheaper than 3 days parking at one of the strip hotels. I was pleasantly surprised. The deals you can get at this hotel can put you off, I asked myself why it was so cheap and having stayed there I still do not know why. We ate at the Triple 7 restaurant / brew pub and enjoyed their local beers. We had breakfast at the Garden court buffet. Both are highly recommended. The hotel is only 2 minute walk from Fremont Street Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age, but clean and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: Cubanito3
Reviews.Content: This casino/hotel is located right off the end of Freemont Street, which makes it a better choice for families and couples that don't want as much of the "adult only" Vegas surroundings. The rooms are showing their age, with a little peeling paint around the tub, but they are very clean. We use this as a stop off on our 2 day drives to see the family, and it is a nice room at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “FOR SOME SERIOUS CRAP TABLE GAMBLING”
Reviews.Author: Chacha2u
Reviews.Content: We all know that everyone travels to "Vegas" to gamble, but what we need to understand is this, that while gambling is on all our minds, there is always a little of something else one is looking for. The list of reasons for some could vary, from taking in a few good shows, doing some off the Strip sight seeing, a little shopping here and there, or looking to be pampered by some of the best hotel, spa and resort casinos found in Vegas. Then, we have those who strictly visit for some good ole' fashion hard core gambling--the one's who dream of raking in as much as possible when a "hot" roller steps onto the "crap tables." You're not going to find this up on the Vegas strip, nor will it be at some of those beautifully placed hotel casinos situated on the out skirts of Vegas. If you're looking for some real serious good crap table gambling, you better jump on your car and head straight to downtown "Fremont" street where all the action is. And for this type of gambling, hands down, we always head straight to the Main Street Station Hotel & Casino and its sister "Boyd" hotels, the California Hotel & Casino and Fremont Hotel and Casino. But, let's just concentrate on the Main Street at this time. Of all the Boyd hotels downtown, the Main Street is the newest of all 3 properties, and conveniently adjoined by a walkway to the California hotel. The casino's high ceilings, wooden panels with a touch of stain glass windows here and there and spaciousness, is not a bit overwhelming, but offers a comfortable atmosphere to maneuver about without getting lost. The rooms too, are nice sized, adequate as far as comfort goes, but may be lacking when it comes to the savvy technology offered by many of the 4 & 5 star strip hotels. But, at this point, who cares, we're here for some good crap table gambling and here to make some serious money. The Boyd hotels are mainly frequented by Hawaii visitors who call Vegas their "9th" island away from home, and who also come to do some serious gambling being that Hawaii does not offer gambling. The buffet offers some great eats and variety at a very reasonable cost too. It really doesn't matter what restaurants in the Boyd's hotel one chooses to eat at because the food is still great and still quite inexpensive. There is one thing you should all know about those who travel from Hawaii to play the crap tables, they'll surely cheer you on to the very moment you release that pair of dice, they'll wait patiently as you set up to make that winning throw, and they'll give out some high five's and maybe even a little dance or song after your number hits. Hands down, they have some the best & longest rollers I've seen so far. You only see this type of action at the Main Street, California or Fremont hotel. You'll even see "golden arm" plaques upon the walls at the California hotel for those who hold the dice for more than an hour plus, and believe me, these hawaiians hold them dice for a long time. If you're an avid craps table gambler, don't lose out on being there during those frequent and special moments when the dice is rolling hot, hot, hot! For those who work the machines only, you'll find a lot of variety and some very good poker machines too. Don't forget to sign up for the Bconnected players card which can be used at all Boyd and Coast properties. The comps are very generous when it comes to rooms and food for players. So, the next time you go to Vegas & want to do some serious gambling, head on downtown, it may not give you the glitz and glamour that the Strip does, but, you're more likely to leave Vegas with some money in that wallet of yours. Happy Gambling!

Reviews.Title: “About as Close as it Gets to "Old Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: Lola1177
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of gaming, eating and staying at Main Street, downtown Vegas. A Boyd property, it is a throw back to the old days in vegas; decor was great, gaming fair, and food reasonable and good. The rooms were average with old tv's; would give them a slight "ding" for that; suggested they put in new falt screens!! Otherwise just a room, which is what most people want in vegas. Easy walk to the canopy covered Freemont St. If you are looking for a fancy room, stay elsewhere; if you are looking for good food, good gaming and old time vegas atmosphere; try this proiperty.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite vegas hangout”
Reviews.Author: chewycat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Main Street Station twice a year and just love the place. My mother-in-law and brother-in-law came with us in March. The rooms are nice, and the people there are very friendly. The atmosphere is comfortable. The machines are looser downtown as well. At the MSS you get a scratch card worth $2-$5000 any time you get 4 of a kind or better!! Also, the brewery makes great beer, and it is not expensive in the casino (drinks are comped if you are playing!!) the 777 brewpub also has sushi. If you want to go to the strip (we don't) the MSS has a free shuttle. I could go on and on, but you get the idea. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “MSS is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Racer123
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is awesome. The dealers are very, very nice and will help amateurs not make mistakes. I like the fact that the blackjack tables have lots of $5 minimums. You won't find this on the Strip... I promise. I like the fact that beer and liquor flow to the tables continuously. It wasn't good for me because I got way too tipsy, but it makes losing (and winning) more fun. The food is great. We ate several times at the 777 Brewery. Good beer, sushi, burgers. The calamari is a must order. Big pieces and good dipping sauce. The rooms were about average. Nothing fancy, but very clean. I didn't have any issues with noise. Overall, MSS is a good value for you dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LnLnFW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at MSS over a dozen times the last few years. The decor and antiques make you feel like you're gambling at grandma's house. MSS has lots of great dealers and friendly staff. The hotel/casino is small compared to places on the strip but we prefer the real people here. For a quick change of scenery we walk across the enclosed walkway to The Cal. You'll find lots of Hawaii people at both properties and most of them are a blast to gamble with. The Cal has a small sports book to make your sports wagers. They don't have horse racing so all the TV's are tuned into some kind of sport.. If you play craps then you'll want to play at MSS with their 20X odds. The only downside to either property is the BJ rules. Dealer hits soft 17 (pretty much everywhere these days)and there is no double after split. Food is fantastic at both places. We enjoy prime rib and sushi at the 777 Pub at MSS and Steak & Lobster ($17.95) at The Pasta Pirate at The Cal. One night is always set aside for The Cals Redwood, the Alaskan King Crab comes in a heaping pile and their pan seared Ahi is the best any where! For a real treat Aloha Speialties has some great Hawaii style food, their Ahi Poke and meatloaf is really tasty. The rooms at MSS don't have coffee but if you'll call maid service they'll bring you a coffee pot (always ask for extra coffee, they jsut bring 2 regular and 2 decafe). You can always go to Lappert's Ice Cream and Coffee for an espresso or latte, they open up at 6:00AM. You'll be greeted by a lovely young lady named Janice. The rooms are comfortable but if you're on a lower floor facing the highway they can be a little noisy. We travel with a small fan that drowns the noise out. The internet could be better but since we got an iPad that's not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS A GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: stevez49Milford_NH
Reviews.Content: MSS is the only place that I want to stay downtown. The rooms are clean. I do not know about a view. In 20 years of going to Vegas I rarely look out the window. I do not go to look out a window. Noise, I do not know. I never here anything when I sleep. If your tired you'll sleep. Coffee pot I do not know. I do not come to Vegas to drink coffee in my room! Service is wonderful throughout thee casino from the servers to the cleaners. The buffet is one the best value, that you will find in all of Vegas. Do not waste you money at high price places like Paris or the new Cosmo. The only slight negative would be, that some of ladies at the players club are rather snobish.

Reviews.Title: “Where a Reservation of Room Tyhpe is NOT a Reservation”
Reviews.Author: graham072442
Reviews.Content: I've always loved this hotel (its cleanliness, the nicely sized rooms, the ambiance, the prices of both rooms and meals, the in-house micro-brewery) - except for one big flaw: a confirmed reservation for a nonsmoking room is regarded as merely a "Suggestion" and, almost without exception, I have to fight to get the type of room I reserved. Because I have breathing problems, this has now become an unacceptable practice; whereas in the past I was immediately moved at check-in to a nonsmoking room when I confronted the desk clerk, this trip I was required to first spend a night in a room where smoking is allowed. The result was a bloody nose for the week and a brown cast to the water in the water reservoir of the humidifier component of my CPAP machine. This is the only hotel where I consistently face this problem. For 38 years, making travel reservations/arrangements for executives was part of my job; and those executives invariably were given the type of rooms that I reserved. The fact that I'm a woman making a personal (rather than business) reservation seems to suggest they have license to ignore my confirmed reservation. So, I'll take my business to the 4 Queens in the future. I can recommend if you are a Smoker, but cannot recommend if you are a nonsmoker and are unwilling to fight for what you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buffet By Far”
Reviews.Author: iannantuonofrank
Reviews.Content: Main Street Station has a wonderful, and inexpensive buffet. The selections were overwhelming. Real food, Great food, and the best buffet experience we had the entire week we were in Vegas. Main Street Station buffet makes the MGM Grand buffet look like "leftovers". Highly recommend you walk the extra block off Fremont street and get the best buffet in town.

Reviews.Title: “Did somebody say tight slots? It sure wasn't me!”
Reviews.Author: LJGull
Reviews.Content: I've never actually stayed at Main Street Station, so I don't know if this review will even be posted. I'm staying there in May (they sent me a 4 night comp + 50 slot dollars, hence the 5 stars for "value"), so I came to look at the reviews. From what I've read, the consensus is that it's a great place to stay. But I did read one review that said something about the slots being "tight", and I couldn't disagree more; I had my best gaming experience EVER at Main Street Station last May. Since the overall gaming experience is a major factor for most people when deciding where to park their luggage in Vegas, maybe they'll let my review of the casino slide through even though I've never stayed at the hotel. Main Street Station awards a scratch ticket worth at least $2 anytime you hit 4 of a kind on a video poker machine, so I spent most of my time playing there last year, even though I was staying elsewhere. Over the course of my stay, I probably hit a couple dozen 4 of a kinds (all my tickets wound up being worth $2) and the hostesses were always prompt in bringing the scratch tickets, even during peak hours. I play quarter machines almost exclusively, but I put a hundred dollar bill in a dollar machine with the intent of playing until it was either gone or I had doubled it. Long story short, it was a "Treasure Chest" machine, I hit 4 of a kind and won the $5000 jackpot. The next night, I hit a royal flush on a progressive quarter machine and won $1100 +. They also had deuces wild machines that pay $625 for four deuces (compared to $250 in most deuces wild machines), I hit that 3 times. All told, I came in with $500 in my pocket, never went to the ATM, and went home with over $7000. I hope that serves as a counterpoint to the review that stated the slots were "tight"; if you spend enough time in casinos, you're occasionally going to have a run of bad luck, no matter how loose the slots are. And it's common knowledge that the slots downtown pay better than the ones on The Strip. I'm looking forward to my stay at Main Street Station in May, that was about the only negative thing I read about it other than complaints about noise from the highway. Which doesn't matter to me, because I generally play until I can hardly keep my eyes open any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but a bit noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Trekkenman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at Main Street Station. We got a great deal on the rooms-- stay two nights get one free! The rooms were basic but decent, however the noise from I-515 kept me up at night. I had to crank the fan on high and still heard the traffic outside. Next time I'll ask for the side away from 515. The buffet was good in variety and reasonable (get a players card to save a buck). The casino was nice but we didn't win anything. Oh well, overall a good deal for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Main Street Station”
Reviews.Author: PamelaOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Main Street Station for the first time. It was recommended to us and I would definately stay there again. We were in Las Vegas for a week. We stayed 1/2 of the week on the strip at Harrah's (which was a great place to stay), and the rest of the week at Main Street Station. Main Street Station rooms were clean and cozy. The price of the rooms were $35 during the week and $50 on Friday night. Great price! The food was good and food prices are about 1/3 of the cost of the Las Vegas Strip hotels. I enjoyed staying "downtown". The atmosphere is fun on Fremont Street at night. We went to Tony Romas for Prime Rib one night. I think Tony Romas is located at the Fremont Casino. It was the best prime rib for $8.99! We took the buses to the strip which was reasonably price. You can take the West Cliff bus which is located off of Fremont St. and it will take you to the airport for $5 per person. Last time we stayed downtown it cost around $40 for a cab. I would definately stay at Main Street Station again!

Reviews.Title: “if it wasn't for the noise...”
Reviews.Author: PenkiArnhem
Reviews.Content: I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone. As mentioned in a previous review, there is no double glazing. There was a constant roar from some sort of air conditioning. It was no problem to change from the 3rd floor to the 7th floor, but it didn't help much. Fortunately I had my ear plugs with me! Otherwise, nice service, good buffet, very kind staff, public transit nearby (you can take the bus to the airport for only a few dollars).

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel, and the slots are not tight like they are on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: pris1972
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's because I am getting older....Who knows, but I loved this hotel. It's a much more laid back and relaxed atmosphere than the larger hotels down on the strip. The servers in the casino here are much friendlier, and the service at the restaurant and buffet is much better. Actually the buffet here is quite good considering it is 1/2 the price of buffets on the strip. I also hit a lot more on the slots here than I did when I stayed at the mandalay bay. I love that you can take the walk way over the street and cut through to another casino and then back down to see the Fremont street experience. Make sure you get a B connected card if you do not have one. Within a week of returning back home, I was sent 3 comp nights to be used any day of the week. Only issue is I won't be able to make it back out to Vegas by the end of April. I tried getting them to transfer the comp nights to Sams town in Tunica, since I am in Ga. They wouldn't do it, which I would have spent more money since I can drive to Tunica for a few days. I just can not stress how much more I like old Vegas/downtown than the strip. Sure all of the shows at those hotels are great to see, but if you are looking for a more relaxed atmosphere this hotel is for you. I also can't stress enough how polite all of the employees are there that we encountered. The cocktail servers were all smiling and were constantly checking on us, unlike the Mandalay Bay where the young girls ignored you and you had to go hunt them down if you wanted something. This is why the great servers at the Main street station were tipped well by me.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise Mainstreet station was!”
Reviews.Author: redken1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at mainstreet the last week of January for 3 days. I was so surprised. The Hotel staff couldn't have been nicer, from the desk clerk to the hostess at their wonderful buffet! We arrived late friday. We would have had there Seafood buffet but we just weren't that hungry. I was so excited to hit the Freemont street experience. So, we ate at the Triple7 brew pub. Yummy, food was good and the Beer was awesome. We know our microbrews cause we live in the midwest and try alot. We had the Santa claus ale, very good chocolate flavored stout. Even if you don't stay here, which you should come for the Beer and the food!!Our room didn't have a nice view but we didn't stay there only to sleep. Give them a try you'll be surprised. If anyone has questions, I would love to answer them.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel,average overall.”
Reviews.Author: Apollocanada
Reviews.Content: Arrived for check in at 2pm,We were told room would be ready at 3pm,no prob we checked bags at bell desk and gambled for an hour. Found the slots here tight throughout our stay,very few winners around us..seems most Vegas Casinos are following suit here.Dropped about $1400 during our stay here on the Main street station slots,most times didn't use our player cards,should have,could have at least built up some buffet comps, Used to see the lights and bells going off when a jackpot winner was found...hardly ever see that anymore.Room was pretty decent as we were on the 16th floor {room 1607} ,there were however some hairs we found in our sink and bathtub when we arrived,not to impressed with the housekeeping we encountered,yet a few housekeepers we met in the hallways were very polite and cheerfull. Second night housekeeping arrived at 3:45 pm and we were back at our room hoping it was made up earlier,told them we would be out in 15 minutes,and they said they would come back. Arrived back at 9pm and one bed was made the other untouched. Phoned housekeeping and a fellow said bed probably wasn't made because there was a phonebook left on the bed..lol! Beds never looked tight when they were made,kind of like I might do myself quickly at home,so I guess it had that at home feeling.Big shout out to the triple seven pub downstairs,great food,wonderfull wait staff,great prices in a awesome pub setting.Went there 4 times in our 5 night stay. Buffet was decent,very reasonably priced.Odd front desk staff never asked how our stay was,as I was hoping she would. Loved the old style of this hotel lower lobby! Takes you back to earlier Vegas days..

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Austin, Texas (We're full...so come visit, then leave)
Reviews.Title: “Main Street Fun!”
Reviews.Author: ap3266
Reviews.Content: Was comped a two night stay after gambling once on another trip. Check in was easy and not crowded. Room was actually very roomy and pleasant. The sheets smelled like bleach, which I liked very much. Standard fare in the room; had useful amenities. The casino is kind of small compared to others on the Strip, but about average for Downtown. The best part is...they have their own brew pub and will bring you pub beer while you're gambling! You have to ask for it, though. The slots were more than a little tight when I played. I just could not get anything going! They have a lot of the older slots and just a handful of new flashy ones. Table games are good. Asians and Hawaiians like this place, apparently. Buffet is okay...nothing fabulous but it is edible food. Did not eat in the pub because I had comped buffets. I might have liked the food there a little better. But then, I didn't come to eat. I came to win money...which I didn't. Definately sign up for their player's card as it gets you comps at several other casinos that are in walking distance. They will send you gracious offers even if you don't gamble a whole lot. And if you do gamble a lot, the offers won't change that much unless you gamble a whole lot. I probably would stay here again if we don't stay on the strip. We visited the other casino hotels, and this place was probably nicer.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: scooterbunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It has a great looking lobby/casino with a lot of nice antiques/chandeliers/stained glassed windows. The room was a nice size and included a small refrigerator which is a nice touch. It also had two chairs that were comfortable enough to sit down in and read. The bed was fairly comfortable. We were on the side where the highway is so it was bit noisy, but didn't keep us awake. We were also up pretty high on the 16th floor. I would still ask for a room on the other side, though. The room was very clean and well kept up. Staff very friendly. A fantastic price, too. Lots of parking and a great valet. Very close to Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Well you'll sleep if your deaf - otherwise forget it.”
Reviews.Author: sheffchick
Reviews.Content: Such a shame. A lovely hotel, newly decorated room with usual (for Vegas) facilities. Very helpful staff. Good bargain buffet and excellent brewpub. BUT: the noisiest rooms I have ever experienced in a hotel anywhere. First room overlooked the motorway. No sleep at all that night. Asked for a change next morning, mentioning the noise (which seemed to be no surprised to Reception), and got changed to one on other side of hotel no problem. Although this room overlooked the railway line the train noise was not a problem (they are few and far between). There was a constant and deafening roar from some sort of air conditioning or heating outlet. And I mean roar. Please, please install double glazing. Other than the noise I would not hesitate to recommend MSS to anyone, but until it is sorted out I would have to warn anyone not to stay here if they need sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Value For New Years Eve, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ktgirl
