Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas between Christmas and New Years. We had comped rooms at Harrahs on the strip until Dec 31. We decided to stay over for New Years and priced the downtown hotels. I was able to book MSS for $107 plus taxes each night for Dec 31 and Jan 1. We were able to check in at 11 am. 14th floor, 2 beds, non smoking floor overlooking the highway and mountains. There was a safe and and a refrigerator in the room. The tv is an older style in a wall unit type stand. The bathroom is small but mirror/vanity area is in a separate area. There are wooden slat shutters on the windows that do let in a small amount of light and there is some noise from the highway. It did not keep us awake. There are also many antiques and beautiful woodwork and chandeliers throughout the property. We had the champagne brunch on Sun am. and ate at the Triple 7 Brewery Pub on New Years Eve. Service and food at both places were very good. While it is two streets over from Fremont, there is a enclosed walkway over the street to the California Hotel and then you cross the street to Binions which is on Fremont. We attended the New Years Eve Party on Fremont by purchasing a $20 bracelet that gave you entrance to the street after 6 pm. We had a great time at the NYE celebration at a reasonable cost. We enjoy downtown Las Vegas and would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The air circulation is horrible!”
Reviews.Author: BMMRA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of people and I will never stay here again. I got so sick from the poor air circulation in the casino area from all of the cigar and cigarette smoke...and I live with a smoker. The corned beef hash at the buffet line looked like puke. No room service. I felt like I had to take a shower everytime I walked in that place, which by the way the shower was the worst part of it all...it didn't stay at a set temperature it would go cold then super hot and burn me. We stayed 2 out of 5 nights we had reserved there and went to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool Place”
Reviews.Author: TylerREBroker
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at Main Street Station...I had just read about the antiques and decor and some of the history and was bored one day and walked down there from the Nugget. It was one of the highlights of our trip. If you are in to antiques and very ornate woodwork, chandeliers, etc.. go take a tour of this place. We also had a beer sampler in their micro brewery...a real bargain! I got five 5oz beers in a sampler for $5.50! While sitting there we could see people eating and the portions and the food were impressive...particularly for the prices. Take the time and walk down there. If you see Marion (one of the security policemen) you might talk nice to him and see if he will take you on the tour of the antiques upstairs....very nice man and very nice tour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, delicious food, & what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusKris
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st stay @ MSS & downtown. I pretty much new what to expect after reading all the reviews on here & kept an open mind regarding the bad reviews.... My friend & I arrived early (10:30) & even though there was not a room ready for us, we were able to request 2 queen beds and south-facing(towards downtown, not the freeway) & to be on the 17th floor. That's the top and was hoping less noise would be heard from the street plus bonus - nobody on a floor above us jumping around! We did hear occasional sirens and some trains went by but nothing that kept us awake at night. So, the desk clerk took our info and said to come back in a couple hours. We did, but the room wasn't ready. Came back at 2 and it was. I think they noted that we had checked and knew we'd be back again so they had it ready. The hotel was booked for the rodeo so I knew they were busy. The room was nice and looks exactly like the pics on the website. Only complaints: shower head is positioned on the wall too low (I'm 5'5 and I had to squat down) & although the wooden shutters are a nice touch, they don't keep the light out when the sun rises. Our room had a small fridge and we hadn't requested one, so that was nice. The beds are super comfy. The room was clean. There's no room service, coffee makers, or coffee in the lobby. They said to go to the casino bar. Of course you'd have to pay for that. Just seems odd they don't offer coffee. The food at the buffet was delicious!! We ate way too much. Recommend the seafood buffet. Crablegs were great, (but bring your own shell-cracker, they don't have any). The staff were all very nice! The hotel is just at the end of Fremont Street & over a couple blocks. Easy to get to. Felt pretty safe walking around outside at night, just kept good eye around us. I probably won't stay downtown again because we spend most of our time on the strip but I was looking for a good deal and you can't beat the price!! We took the bus to the strip which is fine if you're not in a hurry, otherwise we took the taxi a couple times. The bellman will arrange a shuttle for you if you need one to the airport. It leaves at quarter after each hour. All in all we had a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel for Downtown Stay”
Reviews.Author: Recruiting
Reviews.Content: The Good: rooms are fine (think Hilton Garden Inn/Holiday Inn or so), rooms are clean, great value for the price, casino has great folks working it, casino has decent games offered, downtown location is nice in that you can visit many other casinos within short walking distance Other: if you want luxury this is not it (go stay at the Golden Nugget for a tier up downtown or stay on the strip somewhere), was not impressed with their on-site restaurant Triple 7 - would recommend you eat elsewhere (it was not bad, but it was not good) Overall I would stay here again if I was trying to save money on room cost or slumming it solo (bottom line is that it is a clean and decent room for cheap). Would need to kick it up to the Golden Nugget definitely if I was doing a trip with my significant other though.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Vegas for "real people"”
Reviews.Author: boopkc
Reviews.Content: I had such a great stay here, I would really recommend it to anyone. First and foremost, the staff is AWESOME, they go above and beyond to be helpful and make your stay comfortable. I am a customer service rep, and I love to see this kind of customer service! The hotel is clean and lovely. Our room was very nice. I love not being on the busy (Too busy) strip and the Fremont area in old town is so much fun. You just can't beat this place to stay for price, comfort and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: margsalady
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel. Waited over 1 and half hours to be allocated a room and took the first available as designated one was still not ready!! Old fashioned slat shutters on windows ..no curtains so impossible to have room completely blacked out or some sound proofing.. Road works going on around hotel through the night as well as day time, freight train runs along the other side and one of its trips is during the night so the train sounds its claxon!! coupled with these two the Highway runs alongside and finally the noise from the casino's air condiioning fans located on the flat roof below the hotel tower. Informationavailable on facilities very poor. No indication WIFI availabe for use free in Players club, only knew by walking through casino,when trying to use it on 3 occasions I had to ask staff to re-set it, according to photos on website there is a pool but never found it nor is it mentioned . Reception staff less than helpful when I locked myself out of room ( I had been given the stay as a gift from a friend because of an early flight) I had been down to check that there were no additional charges showed keycard and then mis laid it. When I went back all I got was they couldn't let me in unless my friend returned with photo id. this was late evening, all my belongings and contact details were locked in the room. The fact that they were 15 miles away and I had to leave at 5. the next morning did nothing for my stress levels. A floor supervisor had found the keycard and put it in the trash but fished it out when I asked. Reception staff would not check that it was the correct card, I had to go up to room and then let them know!!! I would not recommend anyone to stay here if they want to sleep and to be treated civilly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Friendly, Marvelous Food & Conveniently Located!”
Reviews.Author: GramPamsjrts
Reviews.Content: The most comfortable & clean bed I've slept on in a hotel. They put freshly laundered white covers over everything on the bed, the plush pillow-top and a fresh white duvet cover. Since they actively solicit Hawaiian's as their major clients they pride themselves on showing Hawaiian hospitality. The buffet ruined my diet, but what a way to go!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pamlh1
Reviews.Content: We booked a handicapped room as we had one person in a wheelchair. The room was small but worked out fine for the handicapped user,except there was a tub which Dad was not able to use. We were only there for the weekend so he gave himself a PIT bath. A stay of any longer might not work if someone isn't able to climb over a tub side. The room was clean and even had a small refrigerator. The staff at the hotel were nice and the car valet guys went out of their way to be of help. Would diff stay again. Did not use the restaurants but did do a bit of gambling. Good hotel for the price. As you know Vegas on the weekends charge's double for what a room during the week will cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel at Bargain Price”
Reviews.Author: 3Islanders
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise to find this gorgeous hotel at only about $40 for a weeknight. My husband and I were driving to Arizona and read good reviews on tripadvisor, so booked the Main Street Station for a stop along the way. BEAUTIFUL antiques throughout the property, with free pamphlets at the check-in desk that explain their locations and origin. The room was modern and large enough for our needs, with nice white wooden window shutters instead of those awful hotel drapes that never quite close in the center. We had a lovely view looking out on the night lights of Old Las Vegas toward the Strip. This hotel is in the downtown part of LV, not on the Strip, and was a nice change from our previous Vegas stay. There is no wifi in the room; one must go to the lobby to use it. This is not a biggie in the context of our overall experience, and is one factor in the price being so reasonable. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This place is not recommended if you want to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: donegalone
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Vegas, stayed at this hotel for 3 nights because we had family coming from Hawaii and they were staying here. I will outline our stay and then you can decide for yourself if this hotel meets your travel needs. Price per night was $80, not worth it in my opinion. This was through getaroom, which advertises rooms for $38 but the days at this price are so limited as to be non existent, other searches quoted similiar prices. First room assigned was on 7th floor, we did not sleep a wink as very busy freeway right beside property, with continous traffic all night long. It felt like you were 'sleeping "on the middle of the freeway. Combine that with AC noise and you get the picture. Went to ask for room change at 7 am next morning, asked if all room were priced the same as we felt this room was overpriced (thinking was that maybe noiser rooms were cheaper than other rooms). We were informed that no difference in prices. We did get a new room on the 17th floor on the opposite side of hallway. We had expectations that this room would be better but ,sadly, not the case. The train tracks run right beside this side of building, and until about 2am there were trains passing, in addition, sounds of a digger/excavator but really dont know what this was as no visible building site seen. Also, there are no curtains on windows, only shutter slats that open and close (but don't really close tightly) and our room was located just under a hugh blinking red neon sign that flashed on and off, so another distraction from restful sleep. At this point , I am resigned to situation. Would probably have moved hotels if we were going to stay longer but decided we would tolerate one more night. Other dissatifiers: Dim lighting in room, one of main lamps did not work, clock radio was broken, bathroom tiny, no coffee machine in room, Yes I realise this is a tactic to get you out of your room and downstairs so that you are more likely to gamble! Positives: staff are very pleasant, we ate at Buffet and 777 restaurant, both were good. Proximity to bus station where you can get bus to get to Strip ($7 dollars for 24 hour pass). Can not comment on gaming as spent little time on this here, but smaller and less hectic than bigger hotels on Strip. Hope this review helps you to make your decision about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Bubba
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had talked to several of our friends and they had recommended trying MSS when we wanted to stay downtown so we gave it a shot. Got a great rate online. We arrived about 3 pm and used the self park instead of the valet. Check in took about 10 minutes and we were off to our room on the upper floors. We were stunned at the size of the room. It was huge for downtown. Had a fridge and safe for no extra charge. Yes, we did hear a train...once. The bed was great and the restroom was good with a separate room for the shower and toilet. All the staff were great and everyone we encountered had a greeting. Checkout took about 2 minutes and no problems. This is not the strip but I would really recommend this if you are looking for quiet, clean and economical rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Jayr09
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, clean, and well equipted with hair dryer, ironing board, iron. Pillow top beds were comfy. We stayed 3 nights. We had $4.50 appetizers during happy hour at the Triple 7 (micro-brewery) Restaurant and had a great breakfast with made to order omelets at the Grand Court Buffet. The price and staff was so great for our stay and the location is so close to other casinos downtown, we wouldn't want to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Remodel the rooms please!”
Reviews.Author: Kapolei-acs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in desperate need of remodeling. Let me start by saying we travel to Las Vegas at least 3 times a year and we at various property on and off the strip. If we stay downtown we stay at the Main Street. But lately the quality of the room is really starting to disappoint (19" CRT television and the vanity area, REALLY!). The sad fact is, it wouldn't cost that much per room to serious change disappointment with satisfaction, my wife and I have put enough money in your machines to cover the cost of several rooms (per visit). The loyalty of your Hawaiian customers deserve some place nice. I realize Boyd Gaming have other the projects its working to complete (Star Dust). As a result of our last stay with the noisy in room air conditioner, 19" TV, and the 1970 vanity Boyd properties has fallen to a third or fourth choice. No amount of free comps, will fix this (we don't need the comps). Rather than giving us comps remodel the rooms. I recommend visiting the Golden Nugget Rush Tower for ideas.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: griff10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 1108 on Labor Day Weekend 2010. Room was very average. Had everything we needed including a mini fridge, but not a place that will stand out in my mind or anything. Room faced the freeway and train tracks, but we were high enough up that we never heard any traffic. The entire property is very clean, and all employees we encountered were very nice. Ate at the buffet for Sunday brunch, and it was not great. Had a few ok dishes, but for the most part I was not impressed. Of course, it is not very expensive, so I guess you get what you pay for. The hotel has free parking on site, and it is a short walk to Fremont Street. Never felt unsafe downtown as I have heard some others say. The shining star of this hotel is definitely the 777 Brewpub/Restaurant. The beer they brew there tastes good and is cheap. Also, everything we had to eat at this restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown hotel, by far!”
Reviews.Author: Raven808
Reviews.Content: Believe me, this is the best all around place in downtown Las Vegas. It has a Brewery (Awesome!), a first class restaurant (Pullman Grille) and a classy, antique laden casino. And here is the best part; It has the BEST service in ALL of Vegas. You can actually get a drink when you are playing, whis is a lot more than I can say for the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful, boutique-flavored hotel in downtown Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Travis-n-Tina
Reviews.Content: What a treat it was to discover Main Street Station! Our usual travels usually find us in big-city boutique hotels...something that is sorely lacking in Las Vegas, where "BIG" is king. Enter Main Street Station. The hotel is spotlessly clean, comfortable, and intimate. We had few interactions with the staff, but those we encountered were friendly and warm. Main Street also features a modest casino, which is beautifully appointed with antique fixtures and beautiful Tiffany-esque glass. The entire property has a vintage train depot motif, based on its location near the old Las Vegas rail terminal. It's a wonderful, warm, charming feel! That said, our room did overlook the downtown train train tracks, so there was an occasional horn blast from a passing locomotive. That's a big "who cares" in our book, as the rest of our experience at Main Street was a fantastic departure from the usual Vegas neon frenzy!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Ibbocek
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into this hotel we realized that it was something special. Our check in was immediate (along with the check out) and the hotel staff were extremely friendly. We arrived in the morning and were able to get a room prior to check in - nice! The room was large and comfortable and not too noisy as we were facing the freeway. The sink took a long time to drain but considering all the rest of the pluses of this hotel, it was a minor inconvenience. Their restaurant and buffet, from the friendly service and good food, were top notch. We can't comment on the gambling (only used the slots). The Fremont light show is something everyone should experience - it was a refuge from the 114 degree heat as it is air conditioned or if not, seemed like it. There is an intimate, party like atmosphere - it's a hoot! We visited most of the hotels on the strip and could not believe the chaos that was happening in their lobbies. Their lobbies were a mass of people waiting to check in/out and the lineups for taxis were incredibly long. There was no charm to be found. We took the Deuce and Ace line buses to the strip and the cost was $7 for a 24 hour pass. We were unfortunate to end up on 2 buses that broke down but that's all part the travel experience. We can't praise this hotel enough - stay here rather than those annoying strip hotels, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel near Fremont Street.”
Reviews.Author: the_travelling_dude
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to stay off of the strip and I was pleased with the hotel and Fremont street. The hotel bar ( 777 ) had really good beer and I enjoyed the $5 craps at this hotel and the adjoining California hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The one knock against it, is that if you are traveling with children, the food can be a bit pricey and you can find much better deals on Fremont street and at the California hotel. Also, you have to go downstairs to make use of their wireless internet. It would have been preferable to have access in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, comfy bed and pillows!”
Reviews.Author: wheresdaapplebzdaddy
Reviews.Content: We love being downtown Las Vegas and have always liked doing some gambling and having the buffet at the beautiful Main Street but this is the first time staying here. The hotel has an antique/train depot motif that is quiet lovely. The rooms are standard size rooms but have the most comfortable beds and pillows that I have ever experienced in a hotel. I also liked the fact that instead of using just a comforter they have a duvet type cover over the white "comforter" that can easily be pulled off and washed unlike a typical heavy comforter. The bathroom is rather small but there is a separate dressing area so that is a perk. Our room overlooked the interstate and parking garage but look beyond that there was an awesome view of the mountains. We had the breakfast buffet this time which was good and plentiful enough for the price We also ate at the Triple 7 restaurant which is reasonably priced with good food. You can get a micro brew at the casino bar for 1.50. Wi-Fi can be accessed in the lobby and they do have an area set up for just that. I suppose the only complaint that I do have about the Main Street is after checking out we realized we left a pillow. We phoned less than 15 minutes after our departure and we told the contact person we would be back later in the day. When we did return no pillow and was told that there was nothing noted that we had called. So the moral of the story is do not leave anything behind. There is a pool for Main Streets use at the California that is connected by a walkway. We didn't use it as it was unseasonably cool during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shhhh..don't tell everyone.”
Reviews.Author: jasmestas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because the price couldn't be beat. I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was so pretty and the staff was friendly. The rooms were nice, nicely sized and clean. It was convenient to Fremont Street and the freeway. We were in town for a graduation party, so it was perfect for our four day stay. It must be the best kept secret in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown property”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: We've visited Main Street Station almost every trip since we really like the 777 Brew Pub and buffet, but this was our first hotel stay. We were assigned a room on the 14th floor facing south so had a great view of the strip. The room looked exactly like the photos on the MSS website, and everything was clean and neat. It does have a small bathroom area like other downtown properties, but it was fine for us and found a comfortable feel a to property. I feel safe in the area and have no problem walking over to the California where I can then cut over to the Freemont Street area. When staying downtown, we will definately consider staying again at Main Street.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD STAY”
Reviews.Author: busyladymj
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend of June 4tth. I had been to the Main Street Station other time for lunch or dinner and played slots a couple of times. This is the first time I've spent any time there. Bed was comfy. I plainly enjoyed my stay. The only thing is the buffet was so crowded in the evenings that we had to go elsewhere and it was quite hot the weekend. No prob.

Reviews.Title: “Great gambling and drinking”
Reviews.Author: PinkertonWatts
Reviews.Content: I've not actually stayed at the hotel here - this is simply a review of the casino itself. If you are in downtown Vegas, you are no doubt there due to the cool, laid-back atmosphere, the cheap drinks and the great gambling. Main Street Station has all of these and then some. From the dealers and pit bosses to the bartenders to the servers to the beer they brew in house, this place is second to none. The hotel/casino is beautiful and well maintained. The brewery servers up great microbrews and sports-pub fare for when you need a break from the tables. The dealers are efficient (while sometimes not as spirited as I like....an issue I have with Vegas in general lately) and the location is great if you like downtown. Every time I am here, I have a great time. I have eaten the buffet for lunch, and I was extremely pleased with the huge number of selections, as well as the quality of the food. If you are downtown, don't miss this casino! Its not right on Fremont Street, but moreso located adjacent to the Plaza, or connected to the Cal by a walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bunnyi
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel from The Golden Nugget because we weren't feeling the vibe at the Golden Nugget. We paid $300 for a 2 night stay at the Golden Nugget and $146 for a 4 night stay at Main Street. You can't beat that price! The rooms were spacious enough. We had a king sized bed and there were 2 comfortable chairs for reading and relaxing. Get a room ending in an odd number so that you aren't on the side of the hotel facing the freeway. We had a room ending in an even number and the freeway noise got loud sometimes. We tried to purchase a suite or upgrade to a suite, but they said that suites were not available for sale. It would have been nice to be able to purchase a suite. Our room ended up being fine, though. There was no internet in the room. We would have been willing to pay for internet in the room. There was complementary wi-fi in the lobby, but we could never remember to bring out laptop down. We didn't use the valet parking as it was on the other side of the hotel, near the buffet. Self parking was outside the hotel rooms. It was so convenient! Try to get a spot in the self parking under the freeway so that you can walk straight into the hotel and not have to mess with the stairs or elevators in the parking garage. The brew pub was wonderful! We went there twice. The steak was delicious and even though it was more expensive ($13) than what we are used to in Vegas restaurants, it was really good. Only disappointment was the deep fried cheesecake. We remembered it as being phenomenal 3 years ago, but this time the piece seemed smaller and did not come with ice cream. The price remained the same though. We would definitely stay here again! It is a wonderful place to stay for travelers like us from Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “I know you don't stay in Vegas for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmdesharnais
Reviews.Content: This trip to Vegas was my first. My friend goes every year with her husband, and gets "comp" nights at various Hotels. We stayed 4 nights at the Main Street Station. When she booked the hotel, I was nervous..never having been to Vegas, I thought we were staying in the slums. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived, however. The hotel/casino grounds are gorgeous. The room size was to be expected. Two beds, a desk, a tv, and a tiny bathroom with a separate vanity station. No Wi-Fi in the rooms, but they did offer it in the lobby. We had a lovely view of the mountains and the expressway exit sign for Las Vegas Blvd. Beds were comfortable. Room was "clean" but I did find a lot of dust on the window covers, tables, and some food/drink splatter on the walls. The maid service was good, up until we checked out. Upon check out, I realized I had left my pillow behind and called the hotel (within 10 minutes of leaving) to notify them I would be stopping back to get my pillow in a few hours. They put me through to the housekeeping manager, who stated I could get it from the room myself when I come back if the room hasn't been cleaned yet. Otherwise, they will keep it in the housekeeping station. Satisfied with their answer, I went about my day. At approximately 5:15, I returned to the hotel to claim my pillow. The girl working at the front desk called to housekeeping and made them aware I was there to get my pillow. A man came to the front desk after 10 minutes and told the other worker that they have no knowledge of my pillow being found, and the room has been cleaned and re-rented already. When they told me this, I was a little confused, considering I had been told my pillow would be there for me to pick up - but apparently that's as far as the communication went. I decided that since they had re rented the room, there was the possibility that someone else was using my pillow and I no longer wished to have it back. I know you don't stay in Vegas for their hotels, but this isn't something I would expect from a hotel in The Entertainment Capital of the World.

Reviews.Title: “MAIN STREET STATION EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: dgiese
Reviews.Content: hotel lobby had a nice feel of an old train station...the room was decorated very nice...bed was comfortable....but please bring your on pillow unless you want to put your head on a rock!!!!...big surprise you have to go across the street to go into the pool...big inconvenience...close to fremont though...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: jhlfl
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the price. This hotel is an amazing value. I had previously had their buffet and gambled here. They have some of the best video poker in Las Vegas. I've now had their seafood, t-bone and breakfast buffet. A very good buffet at a very good price. The hotel and casino has a lot of charm. The room is clean and updated with a comfortable bed. The only downside was getting a highway side room, which was very noisy. The staff gladly moved me to the other side for my second night. Also, the room has plantation shutters. They look nice, but don't filter out light in the morning. Otherwise, a nice room for the price. They have their own brewpub (Triple 7) with very good beer and a great menu. Also, the beer is $1.50 at the casino bar. They also have an internet cafe with free Wifi. Because it's a block from Fremont St, it is more low key. But, this hotel has a lot of great things going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rbmeoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Main Street for first time and was pleasantly surprized!! For $36/night we got 5 rooms for 5 men and did not expect a lot for the price. Found the entire hotel & casino to be EXCELLENT! Very clean & neat. Old train station motif was well done without being cheesy or gaudy. Rooms were larger than I expected. Neat, clean, well appointed without being crowded. We stayed in the odd numbered rooms on the south side of the tower, on the 17th floor, as suggested by previous reviews. Decent view at night, quiet, no train or traffic noises at all. Shower head is a little low, @ 5'10", I was the shortest in the group and the water hit me in the lower chest. One in the party had the A/C go out @ 12:30am. Repair man was there in less than 12 minutes. He was offered another room immediately, which he turned down. Repair complete before 2am. Front desk called twice to check on the progress. Buffet is really good, especially the breakfast! Good price, wide selections and well prepared food. Fast, friendly service, attentive without being overbearing. 777 Brewery is great! Really good beers and food. Good selection and decent prices. Neat to watch the brewmaster working on the 2nd floor brewery! Casino was fun. Friendly staff at tables and the hostesses are attentive. Good selection of table games and slots with a direct connection to the California across the street via a covered bridge/walkway. Only 2 blocks from the north end of Freemont St. 3 blocks from the bus station to get to the strip. About $20 cab ride, but, only 4 per cab, you have to request a minivan for 5 or more which does take a little extra time to arrive, or $48 for a limo {worth it once for our group of 5!!!} Would recommend Main Steet to anyone! Excellent service, accommodations, location, and value!! Will definitely stay there again on future visits!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!!”
Reviews.Author: Toastcmu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at MSS during the ACM awards in mid april - this was my first stay/visit to MSS - and it did not disappoint. The rooms (aside from the small bathroom) were very good, and in face, the bed was more comfortable than the one at NYNY we stayed at later. The gambling was perfect for us - $5 double deck blackjack for me (which went to $10 once), $10 pai gow poker, and $3/$5 min roulette. There is adequate VP for my wife and I (even at the 5c level - just 6/5 BP though), and with the scratch cards for 4OAK, my wife and I earned another $2. ;) The best part was the service, whether at the buffet, or in the actual gaming pit - I even had a dealer talk to me 15 mins past her break time without realizing it. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice In Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Main Street Station. I got a $40 rate and feel that the value/$ was excellent. This is not a 4 star property but it's one of the better stays downtown. The location is great, parking is easy and the size and quality of the room was fine. The only complaint would be traffic noise from the adjoining freeway, but that really didn't detract from the stay. If you can get a good rate here, take it and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Mainejan
Reviews.Content: Visiting Vegas from CT twice a year, we prefer to stay downtown, away from the craziness of the strip and besides the Nuggett, the only place is Main St. From the comfortable rooms (who needs fancy when you're hardly there) to the cozy casino where you can't lose your friends, the staff is the most accomodating in town. I think of Angie as my personal cocktail waitress, Julio my private maintenance man, Brenda my private slot host, and Linda my private floor person. That's just how they make you feel. Main St. and the Cal cater to the Hawaiian population and being among them is great. They are such a warm and friendly people. I'd say the only drawback is the unavailability of fresh coffee "and" in the morning, hopefully they're working on that.

Reviews.Title: “Main Street is a quality hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gemini_Cat
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at Main Street based on previous reviews and because we wanted to spend the majority of our time downtime this visit. The hotel met my expectations. The staff was friendly and helpful, though drink service on the casino floor was very sporadic. Room was cleaned daily, only ran into one incident when we observed the sheets were not changed. This was during our stay, not prior to our arrival, so not a deal-breaker. We left a note for the cleaning staff and the incident did not occur again. The buffet was of good quality and we really enjoyed the food at the Triple 7 Brewery. Great location and very bright, compared to lighting in other casinos. I plan to book future visits at this hotel. We did request a higher floor with a strip view. It will still a little noisy with the train. I do not recommend for light sleepers unless you bring earplugs. I'd say bring the earplugs and stay here though, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool experience”
Reviews.Author: Jabswitch
Reviews.Content: Great location in old downtown Vegas. The price could not be beat! Ornate old place. A step back in time. Hotel had it's own casino and brewpub. The rooms were definitely OK - nothing special. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mahalo65078
Reviews.Content: We received "A Special Spring Getaway" and tied this into a regular trip that we take to Vegas for March Madness. We regularlly stay at the Fitz and as a change of pace decided to spend a couple nights at Mainstreet. Although I have always loved the casino we had never stayed at the hotel. It is very old, the room was dirty and the bedspread should have been replaced a long time ago. It is time to update this place. When we checked in I told the receptionist that we were Fitzgeralds customers and they had a chance to impress us. I asked for a "nice room." Instead we had a view of the roof top from the 6th floor looking south. Madness always directs us to a nice hotel with a great sportsbook so we always head to South Point for the weekend. At $45 a night that place is one of the best deals in town. But we at least wanted to experience Mainstreet and its always fun to be downtown for St. Patricks Day. We won't be back

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hulahips57
Reviews.Content: Main Street Station has a special for Hawaiians that inclues meals. Great restaurants to choose, delicious food, and very friendly staff. Location is downtown and close to Fremont Experience and stores on the mall. I stay there everytime I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Crumbs in bed”
Reviews.Author: HIohana
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at midnight so wanted to go to bed instead of gambling. Upon entering the bathroom of our room, I found a piece of hair on the bathroom counter and unsealed plastic cups stacked on the counter. I was irritated but thought it was an oversight. When I pulled the covers of the bed back, I found crumbs on the bed. I was so angry, but too tired, so pushed off the crumbs and slept on the other bed,since we had a double room. When I went to inform the front desk the next morning, the lady was counting cash in a cash box and did not acknowledge me. I had to wait over 5 minutes until she had completed her counting of cash before she spoke to me. It was my second and last time I will stay at this hotel. My previous stay was nice so thought it would be nice, but this experience will not be forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and no frills”
Reviews.Author: sprintf32768
Reviews.Content: The room was fine. Very pleasant decor, but not fancy at all. Definitely no frills -- plastic cups, boring soaps. I am tall, and the shower head was very low for me. I really couldn't stoop low enough to use it. So that wasn't so great. Wireless internet *really* is only in the lobby! Otherwise I was very pleased with the whole property. All the people I saw in the hallways were friendly -- guests and staff! And it was quiet. The bell staff was exceptionally friendly, and so was the gift shop lady. Really, I had a very friendly feeling from the whole property, from bartender to floor staff. But it is not going to "wow" you with Vegas luxury. It is really a very simple place.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiigirl2009
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling back and forth on business to Vegas for over 10 years, and have stayed at many properties throughout the city. I've found that Main Street Station is my favorite choice. It's reminiscent of a bygone Victorian era theme and features a self-guided tour of some remarkable antiques in the lobby & casino area. They even have a piece of the Berlin wall in one of the men's rooms. It's very close to the freeways; the I-15, the I-515, 93, and 95 (these 3 are one in the same by this area). It's 2 blocks from Las Vegas Boulevard also, which if you choose to take it, will take you directly onto the Strip in about 10-5 minutes (but be prepared to add extra time for traffic lights and pedestrian traffic as you approach the Strip though). It's a 5 minute drive to the Las Vegas Premium Outlets (which is right down Main Street and one block over), a 15-20 minute drive to the Strip (with moderate traffic on the I-15), and a little less than a half hour to Henderson or Summerlin. Parking at the hotel is free and ample. They have 2 lots, a garaged one close to the hotel, and an open lot across the street. If you're looking for the glitz and glamour of Vegas, like you see on TV, this probably isn't going to be for you, but if you're looking for a great deal, supernice staff, and a feeling of old-time Las Vegas, this is definitely would be to your liking. Main Street Station has the buffet, which is a great deal and offers a vast array of choices for everyone's palate. It also features the 777 Brew Pub, which has great happy hour specials M-F in the afternoons and $2 beers/wines during that time. A couple of notes: Walking to the Fremont Street Experience is easy via the California Hotel, less than 10 minutes. Also, note that due to the economic downturn, there are a lot of homeless/transient people in downtown Las Vegas. They're harmless for the most part, but if you decide to walk around alot, you may be approached by those less fortunate asking for money. The hotel itself is very safe and there's security all over. There's no room service, but there is a refrigerator in the room, which comes in handy when you have leftovers or want to keep cold drinks nearby. When I've had problems with my room (such as the A/C going out when it was 105 degrees outside), the maintenance staff was there in no time. Same thing for housekeeping when I needed additional amenities. Beds are clean and comfortable. The plantation shutters block out the sun quite well if you want to sleep in. They can be opened to view the railway, the beautiful mountains, & points south (you can see Palace Station and the Palms from this side), or on the other side, which provides views of the freeway (which actually helps if you're planning to go on it, a heads up on traffic is always a good thing), more mountains, & points north. The restaurant staff is very accomodating and the bar staff are exceptionally friendly and kind. The front desk people go out of their way to help. I could stay at other properties in Vegas, and have, but I always look to Main Street Station to meet all my "home away from home" needs ... and they always do!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back!”
Reviews.Author: e1b5
Reviews.Content: Was very excited to learn that this hotel/casino lived up to all the hype on the Trip Advisor website. The service was wonderful including a bellman that went out of his way to help us check in for a flight, dealers who always greeted us with a smile, bartenders at the brewery who were very helpful, etc. We enjoyed being downtown for the value but also a step away from all the hustle and bustle of the fremont experience. We are definitely going back next trip to Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel just one block to fremont street experience”
Reviews.Author: milton40
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean. King size bed had a light down comforter with a bright white sheet(bedspread) covering it. As new occupents of the room move in the cover sheet (bedspread) is also changed. I have been in a few luxury hotel rooms with beautiful thick, fluffy bedclothes making me wonder "when was the last time this stuff was laundered and changed" Here at Main Street Casino you can rest assured that you are not sleeping under someone elses dust and dirt. Bathrooms were also spotless, however they are on the small side with tub/shower close to the toilet. Adequate sink ares is outside the bathroom. If your room faces the interstate you will hear some traffic noise. Casino clean, food (great buffet) and microbrew great. Employees friendly and helpful. One block walk to the Plaza which is at the beginning of the Fremont Street Experence.

Reviews.Title: “Really satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Goodpace
Reviews.Content: This is another option way past the strip off the Fremont Pavillion. It is priced right ($45 a night for me) and offers great quality bedding and linen. It was clean and cozy. The drawbacks are the same as any as far as the Fremont location as you have a twenty minute ride on the Deuce (double-decker bus) to the Strip. If public transport isn't your style, this may not work for you. Taxis, by the way, are really expensive in Vegas. One note is that the food we had there was really sub-par. We should have learned after the first time, but we went back again. Eat outside the casino if you are picky about that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and a very good buy!”
Reviews.Author: elizmichael
Reviews.Content: I visited here in June 2009. Main Street Station sleeping rooms are so nice. Clean and fresh rooms. The bedding was soft, fresh and appeared new. The bathroom was even fresh looking! My room view looking towards downtown was nice. The night lights were so colorful right from my hotel room. I felt safe and I felt clean my whole visit here at this hotel. The buffet meal in the large resturant was good. What a selection of foods. The wait staff was also so sweet! This hotel is such a good buy! The hotel is close to the city bus line and I rode the city bus to and from "The Strip". The hotel is also 2 blocks or less to "The Fremont Experience." There's even an enclosed people walkover to the neighboring hotel and more shops! Cool! What a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in old Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pinballnut
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay near Old Las Vegas, this is the place to stay. It is a block off Old Las Vegas, making it quiet at night (ask for a room not facing the Interstate). The rooms are very nice and the brew pub is good (unfortunately, no IPA on the casino floor). Food prices are very reasonable and the quality is very good. I liked this better than the Bellagio. The only downside is there is not a pool in the hotel, but it is a short walk across the connecting bridge to the sister hotel - a shorter walk than some hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Get the most for your buck by staying at Main Street Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holoholomama
Reviews.Content: We had excellent service while staying at the Main Street. The rooms are not luxurious but were very clean and met our needs. Being downtown, close to the outlets was convenient for us. The best part was the meal package that the hotel offers. We were able to eat for free and the delicious buffets and at their "sister" hotels (i.e. Sam's Town). I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Decide Which Is Better”
Reviews.Author: Redhead267
Reviews.Content: My last trip to Vegas, I stayed at the Californian (the adjoining hotel) and loved it there; however, I found MSS to be everybit as nice as the CAL. It will just be a cointoss to see which I stay at over Christmas. The only difference was that the MSS sent me a card for reduced rate and a free night which The CAL never did. The only problem was the food in both casinos was soooo good! I think I gained 5 pounds (or maybe it wa that delicious ice cream in walk over). Don't even think about leaving without trying that ice cream! I never made it down to the Strip; didn't need to go.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sp0rty
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas at least three times each year and this is the only hotel that I have stayed at more than once. I really like this little hotel. It is very neat and clean throughout especially in public restrooms, restaurant and rooms. The beds are super comfortable with pillow top mattresses and down comforters. The casino was not very smoky this trip - maybe they've corrected the ventilation problem or maybe people don't smoke as much as they used to. Parking is easy, valet and bell are super kind, check in easy, room was always cleaned in a.m. Quiet in rooms. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and an excellent value”
Reviews.Author: meijames
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean & recently renovated. Everyone that I dealt with at the hotel was pleasant. If you are looking for a super fancy hotel with spas & other mega hotel amenities go elsewhere. If you are looking for a safe & clean room Downtown where the gaming & dining are much cheaper, this is an excellent choice. It's the most laid back place I've stayed at in LV. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had lots of healthy selections.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed many times at Main Street Station, but first review!”
Reviews.Author: heisman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this nice hotel many times, but we have never completed a formal review till now. It is about time we report the positives staying at Main Street Station as experienced by us. My husband and I stayed at the Main Street Station for first three nights of our July trip, arriving July 19th, a Sunday, at about 10:30 a.m. We usually have to wait for our room to be ready at MSS and they did not have a king room available at this time as well. However, there was a high floor,two queen, non-smoking room facing away from the highway available at that time so we gladly accepted this option. The spotless room had two beds with a bedside table between them with a clock, two comfy chairs at a table by the window, a decent sized desk and huge mirror, television and roomy dresser drawers. Enough room and hangers in the closet area also and the room itself was not small or crowded. For description purposes, the inroom safe in the closet has a key instead of the electronic keyless entry. The room is bright as the windows are from one end of the room to the other. There are shutters which do a good job of blocking out the daylight if you prefer it dark, but we keep them open all the time. The beds were soooooo comfortable and far better than the bed at the Golden Nugget that we stayed at for the next three nights. The bedspreads are the ones that can be washed regularly instead of the ones you see at other hotels questioning if you are the first to see it after cleaning. This room had a small dorm size refrigerator, but this was the first time we have had a frig in our room. Came in handy for the water, soft drinks, and the leftover cheesy garlic bread with marinara sauce from Triple 7 for a midnight snack for my husband. The room is also equipped with a hair dryer in the sink area which is outside the bathroom. This separate room of bath/shower/toilet from the vanity/sink area enables both of us to get ready at the same time. The vanity has enough space to put all our "stuff' on it. The bathroom is big enough for the tub and toilet and not much more. The shower head is installed lower than the norm, however, so my husband had to adjust it, but it was fine for my five foot two self. Air conditioning worked perfectly and we had no issues with maid or checkout service either. A railroad track next to MSS did have a train traveling on it once during the night, but it did not bother us. We saw the time and temperature from our room atop the Fitz or Binions which was quite handy. Not fancy, but super clean, roomy, and bright. There is no pool on the premises, but they offer the California pool across the skyway. We do not use this pool here so could not comment on it. We are frequent visitors to the Triple 7, which has a good weekday happy hour, TVs all over to watch a game and a very pleasant atmosphere overall. There is a sushi bar onto one side, but we have not used it. Good food in Triple 7 at decent prices with or without specials and the microbrews are very good, the best we have tasted in Las Vegas. We like the Triple 7 and the atmosphere throughout this casino. Not recently, but we have eaten at their beautiful buffet and we will return. The chef making the omelets is quite entertaining. We frequent this casino and recognize the same staff there year after year so it must be a pleasant working environment there. In my opinion, this is the most interesting casino downtown as there are many wonderful and beautiful antiques, stained and uniquely etched glass purchased from throughout the world, even a portion of the Berlin Wall in the casino's mens room. The lobby is a beautiful reminder from yesteryear. Except for the mens room, I do a little tour every time I am in this casino admiring these "finds". Not often can you be playing blackjack under huge and beautiful stained glass ceiling and antique chandeliers. Even if you need to have to stay in a fancy room on the Strip, you should come here just once to see how interesting this casino is. You will regret not bringing your camera!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value with atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Davidsonmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed two weekends with a trip through Utah & Arizona in between. First weekend received a free upgrade to a suite. Very nice except it was on the "freeway" side. Loud traffic even on the 16th floor. Second weekend our room was on the "plaza" side. We were on the 17th floor with a king bed. Not a suite but a very large room. I had read reviews about the train noise. We only noticed the train noise one night about 11PM to 12AM (1 hour). It wasn't really an issue for us. The rooms are clean and spacious. Extremely pleasant staff. The hotel is nostalgic in design and atmosphere. I would definately recommend this hotel. Very reasonably priced. The restaurants were great too, especially the buffet (huge).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: marcodreamer
Reviews.Content: My DH and I stayed here in July for 1 night. We have never stayed downtown and since we were arriving on a Saturday, this seemed like a good (and economical) choice to give DT a try. We arrived at 9:30 am and were promptly given a room. Asked for a quiet room and that is exactly what we got! We could see the FSE lights from our room, but could not hear any noise (including from the trains). ROOM was very clean and everything worked well. Only negative is the size and age of the bathroom. Shower head was so short DH had to tip it all the way up to be able to even get under it. Tile and grout were old and stained up, but kept clean in spite of the age. FOOD - only had the Champagne Brunch. It was good, as MSS buffet usually is. Had 2/1 coupon so it was also very inexpensive. Brought the champagne in little plastic cups. Kind of seemed odd as everything else seemed pretty upscale. Definitely not a big deal though. Love the CASINO - always have! Overall very good stay. Good rooms, good customer service, good food and great casino! We definitely plan to stay here again, but for more then 1 day next time!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the MSS”
Reviews.Author: RosaElliott
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Vegas, stayed at the MSS for four nites, rooms are always comped, this time we received an Aloha coupon booklet for food (nver had to pay for a meal in 4 days) Rooms are clean, there is a fridge and safe. Staff are friendly, the slot tournament is a blast. MSS is not far from Freemont Street, you can walk to the Plaza in less than 5 minutes. There is nothing to be afraid of walking down the street, if you are worried, just walk over the bridge to the CAL and cut into the back door of Binions. I tried the GN for 3 nites, and it was okay but I felt more at home at the MSS. Hubby won lots of money on the slots at the MSS and the CAL. There is a new lounge open at the Vegas Club featuring the Next Movement - who are great. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option downtown!”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNGuy
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the MSS June 27, 2009 in Room 529. The Good: Room was clean and seemed to be updated. Has a safe. Price was right for sure. Friendly helpful staff. Casino has great odds and friendly dealers. The Buffet is decent and convenient. If you want the true buffet experience, this isn't the one to go to but it is good if you just need a break for the tables. The Bad: This hotel is not ON Freemont street, it is 2 blocks off. Walking to Freemont isn't bad, but don't go solo at night. It is a little shady on the street from MSS to Freemont.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying downtown at the Main Street Station”
Reviews.Author: camera7
Reviews.Content: We just got back from another trip to Las Vegas. We've gone once a year for the past several years and always have a great time. We've stayed on the strip a few times, but over the last few years have preferred to stay just off the strip at places like the Orleans, Gold Coast and the South Point. This time we got a great deal on the Main Street Station and decided to give staying downtown a try. We had been to MSS once before to eat at their good buffet and remembered it as vaguely nice, but I was still a little hesitant to be downtown and away from the Fremont Street Experience at that,. They rate we got for 4 nights was great so we gave it a try. Location: MSS is just a very short and safe walk from Fremont St and is only a few blocks off the interstate highway that more of less parallels the strip. Getting to strip hotels was quick enough (although traffic in Las Vegas just keeps getting worse every year). Food: We only ate at the buffet for a couple of meals and it was good, but not as great as I remembered. The buffet room may be the most beautiful in town. Staff: Everyone we encountered at the hotel was great and very friendly. Rooms: The rooms are fairly comparable to the other places we've stayed. Very nice, but not overly plush. My one disappointment was not having a coffee pot in the room. Since there is no coffee shop in the hotel (there is one at the California which is connected to the MSS by an elevated walkway) you are forced to leave the hotel or get it from a casino bar. Casino: We did not play much there but it is very nice and not smoky.

Reviews.Title: “Good place,Good price”
Reviews.Author: George C
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Mainstreet Station.Rooms are clean,A/C worked fine.They have there own brewary,Had hot wings at 4:30 AM.What is better than that.We almost always stay downtown and have stayed in almost all casino/hotels there.This one ranks very high(maybe the GN a bit nicer),for the price this is the place you want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Good casino too”
Reviews.Author: LouLouLouey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 3 days. We had a very big room. Both the bedroom and bathroom were clean. The hotel apparently has been voted as having the best buffet in Vegas. We didn't try the buffets at other places so can't really compare, but we were very impressed with the Main Street buffet. We really loved the casino too. There was a very friendly vibe about the place and it wasn't pretentious at all (which we found to be the case with other, top-end, casinos). Plus the minimum bet on games such as roulette was lower at Main Street, which suited our budget. I guess the main drawback to Main Street is that it is not on the Strip, but we didn't find it to be a problem - we either got the Deuce bus (which stops about 1 minute walk away) or drove. (All the attractions on the Strip we went to have parking). It is within easy walking distance of the Fremont St experience and the many casinos in that area. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place - Best in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: BostonPenguin
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cool, friendly, non-mega-resort hotel, book now! The casino is fabulous with a wide array of games and boy were we lucky! All the cool antiques give this place a feel of real old-time Las Vegas. It's very affordable and off the beaton path which allows for you to relax. Sister properties California & Fremont are also great gaming options, and you can use the pool on the roof of the California. I will ONLY stay here from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Kiddie Free Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Trontroland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend with an old high school friend who chose the hotel. Having stayed on the strip many times, I would not have thought of staying in this hotel but was pleasantly surprised. I could leave 6th floor and be out on the gaming floor in less than 5 minutes! The downtown scene is a fresh change from the strip, and worth spending a night or two checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value...like a casino in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: ficusyou
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Main Street Station several times over the years when meeting up with family from Hawaii. It really does feel like I'd imagine a casino in Hawaii (at least the people there :). It isn't a fancy place, but it's well kept and has a bit of a homey feel to it. I'm not a huge fan of the Fremont street area, but gambling in the California and Main Street are pretty relaxing to me.

Reviews.Title: “A great Location”
Reviews.Author: happyinvegas
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! Very comfortable and everyone friendly! Ours needs were met even with a coffee pot in the room. It's very close to the Fremont Experience. We'll stay again when we go to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: davidbViennaVA
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times but have never stayed downtown so I thought I'd try the Main Street Station for 1 night. The hotel itself is fine - lobby is designed in a faux old west motif. Check in and out was quick and the brew pub had prompt service and ok food. The room (17th floor) was nice and a bit larger than expected, but I still heard train noise at night. The neighborhood is sketchy and even though I am a NYer by birth, was a little uncomfortable walking the 2 blocks back from the delightfully tacky Fremont Street Experience at night. Room was very cheap - $36 plus tax. It's a deal, but a long way from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Main Street Station-a great place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: morrtravel
Reviews.Content: Close to Fremont St, but a world away. Few children, beautiful rooms and friendly, helpful staff. If you prefer a little calmer atmosphere, this is the place for you. Perfect retreat after a day on the strip, or Fremont Street, good food and nice casino - what more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain”
Reviews.Author: krisbob
Reviews.Content: We had visited the Main St. Casino last year on a trip Downtown and thought we would like to stay there for Christmas 08. We booked back in February and got a $40 a night rate! Our room was as good as we expected. Following on from Tripadvisor advice we asked for an odd numbered room and got one on the 11th floor with good view. We ate & drank mainly in the 777 Brewery pub or in the Cal across the bridge. And both were very good. Gambling was fun and quiet apart from the Saturday night which was as busy as you'd expect for a Vegas weekend. One small gripe was that their one roulette table didn't open until 12 noon so we couldn't play our favourite table game in the morning. The whole Freemont Street experience was fantastic and so much more fun than being squashed and trampled on the Strip. What has happenend to the skyline up there? Even the once proud Strat is being dwarfed. Less is more people!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: bigmoumout
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful with nice and clean rooms. Nothing fancy compared to The Golden Nugget but for the price ($40), it was an excellent deal. It seems that the odd-numbered rooms are more quiet. Parking fee is $3 but you get your money back at the cashier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Buffet”
Reviews.Author: kim89103
Reviews.Content: I ate at the Buffet twice at the Main Street Station hotel and casino it was better than marvelous. The buffet is all day long serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. The cost for breakfast was under $10.00 and you can use you points obtained on a players club card if you game at all during your stay or visit at the hotel. It has hotel rooms, a casino a full bar (alcohol beer mixed drinks) and of course the buffet was excellent. I would eat here all the time how good it was. They have one of my favorites kelbasi and smoked at the buffet and is rather large like the one at the Orleans hotel and casino we got this free for joining their players club at this casino and hotel on Tropicana. Las vegas is a great but you have to travel with others is safer never by yourself. Great backpacking experience for first timers to visit las vegas nevada.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Old Fashoined Vegas Downtown Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff42
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying here and I was very pleased. I received a mail offer for 2 free nights. The offer included weekends. This offer was based on play I did last Sept. 2007, only 2 hours play or so, less than 1000 points. I stopped in just to try their home brewed beer, which is very good. I booked a room for myself for Aug. 22nd-24th and they gave me a second room for my sister at the casino rate, $53 a night. There were 5 of us total in 2 rooms. Check-in was fast and easy. We were given adjoining rooms on the 17th floor facing Fremont Street, 1709 & 1711. Even though these were smoking rooms, you couldn't smell a whiff of tobacco odor. Not any at all! The rooms are large and come with a fridge and in-room movies. No room service though. The beds are comfy with a pillow top. The pillows are soft so you may want to bring your own. See pics. Elevator service was fast and efficient the entire trip as well. Food: We ate at The 777 BrewPub for dinner. A 16oz prime rib or Ribeye dinner is $13.95. Nothing was more than $13.95. There is also a sampler of all their beers for $5.50. The food was excellent but the service is a bit slow and overworked. They take your drink and food order at the same time. The menu has everything you would find at a sportsbar or Applebee's type place. LCD TVs incircle the dining area so you can watch the game, boxing, or car race while you eat. We had breakfast in the buffet, which was more like brunch. It was $6.95 per person and very good! There were tons of choices including Chinese and pizza. Drinks are brought to your table and served in large tumblers, 32oz size! We had no complaints about the food in Main St. There is also a high end steak house "The Pullman Grill, about $30 per person. The casino was just OK for me. My sis and younger brother made out better than I but don't expect to win a huge amont, just enough to keep playing for awhile. There was no problem with cigarette smoke in the casino. It was well ventilated. Join the slot club and they will probably invite you back based on how much you play. We are just low rollers but this place caters to us. There are lots of Hawaiians staying here I noticed. They are good casinos mates; they play big, are quiet and don't bother anybody. In fact, all the clientele were very polite and unselfish, unlike other places I've stayed at recently. People would hold doors open for you or hold the elevators for each other. It was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Aloha here!”
Reviews.Author: jipc
Reviews.Content: Booked through Vacations Hawaii. MSS was fantastic. Quiet, clean, comfortable. Great staff. Buffet excellent. 777 Brew Pub excellent. Walking distance to Fremont Street. The best part is the Aloha Specialties restaurant on the walkway connecting to the Cal. The saimin with tofu was so ono!! If you are local- the MSS is the best downtown of the Boyd properties. We had a great time and can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Every Time”
Reviews.Author: ezkahuna
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to the Main Street Station Hotel/Casino. I really like this property - very relaxed and low key. The rooms are always comfortable and quiet. Good TV stations to watch, iron, hair dryer, lotion, etc. The bathroom could use some upgrading. The Main Street Sation and the ajoining California Hotel really cater to the island people. Our family stayed here in 2006 for our family reunion (almost 100 of us from Hawaii and the mainland). Our rooms included coupons for three free meals a day at the restaurants on the property but we didn't use them all. Many of our meals were eaten at the Aloha Specialties Restaurant just across the catwalk to the Califonia Hotel. By the way, if you have left over food coupons, you can trade them for to-go items at the small cafeteria-style cafe on the bottom floor of the California Hotel. We traded our coupons for to-go pastries, drinks, candy, etc before we left for our trip home. There are many antiques to see and the place is just beautiful to look at. There is part of the Berlin Wall in the Men's restroom next to the Buffet. Fittingly, there are urinals attached to it. Hahah! On this last trip my nephew won $3368 on a progressive quarter machine. Sweet! We get free room offers all the time from the Main Street Hotel. We took advantage of the deal this last time, three days, two nights, all for free. Service was excellent and so was the room. The 777 Brewery is a great place to eat and visit. They are not open for breakfast but you could eat at the buffet or do as we did and cross over the catwalk to the Califonia Hotel and eat at the coffee shop downstairs. They also take your food coupons there. Spam, rice and eggs! Broke-da-mout! Ono!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “I've Had Better Rooms Downtown”
Reviews.Author: vegasvarment
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the 4 Queens, The Fremont and El Cortez and my room at MSS, #1427 was the most disappointing. I like to add a new hotel on eachof my visits and thought MSS would be a real treat, wrong! If they've done any remodeling to the rooms this one was skipped. I've never seen so many color schemes in one room. I'm not big on decor but this was butt ugly! Obviously the people at registration are not trying to impress new guests as I was placed in a room with the railroad tracks right outside my window. Needless to say the train whistle woke me up a couple of times during the night out of a dead sleep. I also found the hotel to be too far away from the other properties so in that respect, I wouldn't stay there again. The hotel does get a lot of great reviews so I'm chocking up my experience to being placed in one of their less desirable rooms. Just be sure to ask for a room away from the train tracks. The hotel itself is lovely especially the registration area. The champagne brunch was delicious and I highly recommend their buffet. I didn't get a chance to eat anywhere else but will visit Triple 7 on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “A whole different atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: LoveCo50
Reviews.Content: After we ate at the buffet last year we had to see if the rest of the hotel was as magnificent as the restaurant and the casino. After reading so many great reviews of MSS that we had to try it. It has an open, no rush, old fashion feel. I wanted to stand at the top of the stairs and just take it all in. The antiques were great. There was a little map with all the explainations of what each item was. I needed more time to see everything there and get pictures. The beds were very comfy, pillow top I think. Clean, quiet, not crowded. We had the elevator to ourself with very little wait. I usually have complaints about maintance in other hotels, but not this time. Everything was working. We ate at the buffet often. Tuesday was T-Bone night. It was great. The staff was always friendly and helpful. To get to and from Freemont Street go through California (Hotel)and Las Vegas Club if you don't want to be on the street, or walk down Main Street and see the other railcars. Parking was easy and free. No tickets to validate. Would reccommend it. It will be our first choise when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “what a cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: swtreveng
Reviews.Content: We came down to Vegas from Sparks NV. We were going to Vegas to see Kenny Chesney. I dont particularly care for Vegas I like Reno/Sparks better. I dont like the Strip, too much xrated stuff on the street. Too Noisy. So we decided to stay in downtown Vegas.I chose Main Street Station because I loved the decor.The buffet was excellent. I read reviews about it being near the freeway and the train. I was concerned about the noise from that. We heard nothing. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, the staff was great. It is really a beautiful hotel. If I ever go to Vegas again, I would stay at this hotel and highly recommend it. On a scale of 1-10 I give it a 15. Excellent value,excellent location.Nancy Sparks NV

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Secure & fun”
Reviews.Author: AlohaGT
Reviews.Content: Main Street Station: Las Vegas Date: June 4,to 9th,2008 Reviewer: Recent TripAdvisor Member , Kaneohe, Hi. Dad and I just returned from this short trip to Las Vegas. This review is for first time M.S.S. visitor's or someone who has not been there in six year's or more, like me. I remember Main Street Station well, after all this time. It was October 12, 2001 a month after 911. Security was very tight then. It is not as tight now, but there seems to be allot of Police, plain clothed undercover and Security at M.S.S. I have a disability to my hand and ware a sleeve and a glove. I know everywhere I go I am watched, I feel safe and secure. It does not bother me at all, being watched. Actually I feel privileged that I am constantly being watched over. So this is a plus at M.S.S. In fact at all the Casinos we went to Security followed us all around , I know it’s the same for Hawaii too. That’s my life. The room we were in only down side was the third floor roof top view of A/C, equipment. But I managed to take a few nice pictures I think, to make the best of my stay. I felt kind of dumb founded, Why you ask? Well I brought along my iron and hairdryer, like I did in 2001. This is all provided now. Wow! So check first before you pack. This trip was really for Dad to play all the Casino games to his heart content. This was not a Megabucks win but a Father & Son’s fellowship jackpot. We had a wonderful time, enjoyed each other 247, you know what I mean. As they say you loose track of time, so true we forgot to eat and sleep the first 25 hours. I am a Lacto-Vegan so the food at the Garden Court Buffet was perfect for me. This is why the Boyd Hotel package was my choice. I Did not rent a car this time, so food needed to be at a walking distant for Dad, who is 84. God bless him, walking can be a slight problem in the heat of the day for him. The weather was perfect for him 70's 90's. spent most of the time in the Casinos. The room was the same as I remembered it in 2001,very comfortable. Had to turn the A/C down because of less humidity and dry air. The Good: I have very long hair,and washing my long hair and drying it makes it soft and limp. I loved it. Not like here in Hawaii which becomes very dry and brittle. Not so Good: Is the usual , the dry skin problems,I washed my face with my hair conditioner which did a great job. You gain one and you have to compensate with the other conditions. You learn fast to lip balm first before you smile. Ha ha ha. Ouch! that hurts. All in all we had a very good stay at the Main Street Station nice and homely feel. The food was good, the people were kind and courteous, as I remembered our last stay in 2001. it is still great. If 18 months or more have passed or you have never stayed at a Boyd’s Hotel Casino Do sign up online for your Player's Gold card,before you get there. If you do, it will be real fast so you can start loosing your money even faster, or maybe “Hit the big one“, and with 4 of a kind, max bet you will receive a scratch card worth $$$$. I signed us up online for the Player’s Gold card because of our out dated Player’s card had expired. So after we received our luggage, we headed down stairs. It was fast and easy, I just handed the nice lady our copy of our registration, and we received our cards with spring card keeper within minutes, and was playing lose your money fast. Ha,ha,ha that’s Vegas yeah! (pupule) Crazy, insane. I do recommend, a higher floor if you want a better view of the far off strip. But if not, you will be down to the Casino in no time. We had an Ice and beverage Machine on our floor, Not sure if every floor has one. So there you have it ,our trip and stay at the Main Street Station and my few recommendations. Dad had a blast playing The Twilight Zone 1 cent slots, near the entrance, He made $106 dollars in less than 20 minutes the morning of our departure. So you can say you win some and lose more most of the time. Good luck with your stay at the Main Street Station. We did. AlohaGT

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: shelltee
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised as we knew this was an "older" hotel. The rooms were nice and clean and they were very nice and helpful. The breakfast buffet was really good. We were on the south side and while we heard the train once in the night, that is about all that we heard. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: HeatherFLondon
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 Brits stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May and couldn't have been happier with the well appointed rooms and great value breakfast buffet. The Triple 7 brewery within the Main Street Station produces some great beer and our meal at the Pullman Grill was one of the best we had during our stay in the US. If you're looking for great value in a nicely appointed hotel without all the over-the-top bling of some of the Strip resort hotels, give the Main Street Station a go. You may be surprised!

Reviews.Title: “North side room noise was unbearable for me.”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGuy58
Reviews.Content: The difference between a north side (even numbered) and south side (odd numbered) room at the Main Street Station is like night and day. Unfortunately the north side rooms are facing and just too close to a busy freeway. On the first night of my stay I got stuck in a north facing room 1416, and even on the 14th floor the sound and vibration of 18 wheeler after 18 wheeler mixed with the occasional (but very noisy) train was just too much for me to deal with. From around 1am-5am I got about 20 minutes of sleep (estimate), at which point I called the front desk and asked if any south side rooms had become available, there were none, although I was able to move to one the next day 1405. At various points during my tossing and turning I thought about going down to the casino to get drunk so I could pass out (I was only a little buzzed when I first tried to sleep), but the idea seemed a bit absurd and I figured I'd just fall asleep any second now...any second now...you get the point. Eventually I got about 4 hours sleep and moved to the south side room for the second night and that was just fine, but this was my third stay at Main Street and my first time getting stuck in a north room, and I strongly encourage anyone who is a light sleeper or who does not plan to pass out drunk to not accept a north facing room here. Either insist on a south facing room or ask them to transfer you to one of Boyd Gaming's many sister properties, there is the adjoining California, the nearby Fremont, as well as Gold Coast, The Orleans, Suncoast, and Sam's Town. Check-in time is 3pm, if you can't be there at or around that time you might get stuck with a north room. I showed up at 6pm on a non-holiday Monday and they didn't have a single south room. So if you are going to be late arriving, I suggest booking your room elsewhere unless you have experience sleeping in noisy environments or war zones or plan to bring earplugs. As far as the rooms, property and service goes I have absolutely no complaints. Check-in/check-out was a breeze, no wait at all. Cocktail service and restaurant wait staff were all quick and friendly. The property is well maintained and clean. The rooms themselves are very nice and underwent a recent renovation a few years ago. The beds are comfy, the rooms look great, bathrooms are decent if not overly large. One other problem is the property is just a bit isolated in the downtown area. While it isn't a long walk from Main Street Station to Fremont Street, it is a bit of a jaunt from Main Street Station to the middle or east end of Fremont Street.
